**Job ID: 27545**
 Are you passionate about data and driven change? Would you like to build deep insight into the data landscape in Asset and Wealth management (AWM), where data plays a key role for business? We are looking for a Junior Data Governance Expert to drive that data is fit for the digitalization of the bank and explore new ways of working with data with an emphasis on data quality both for business and regulatory purposes.
   

  

 At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Welcome to AWM COO in the Application Portfolio and Data Management team. You’ll join AWM COO, a professional, fun and collaborative unit striving to “make it happen” – delivering excellence through tangible results. You will play a valuable role in identifying, defining and diagnosing data issues in addition to supporting Data Owners in best practices in the implementation of data governance and data quality management.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Work closely together with Data Owners and Data Experts in order to bring their data assets under governance. You will provide support ranging from the practical implementation of data governance to communicating our data governance framework and data strategy.
* Drive the data quality of AWM data. This includes the implementation and monitoring of data quality controls and data quality measurements in operational business processes.
* Be one of the main responsible people for driving and implementing data governance in Nordea and work closely with our data steward on an operational level.
* Be responsible for monitoring the effectiveness of data governance implementations in ‘Business as Usual’, which includes reviewing monthly data quality reporting and supporting the business in resolving data quality issues.


 The role is based in Helsinki, Stockholm, or Copenhagen.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. We are looking for a pro-active, energetic and result driven individual to take this role to the next level!
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you are/have:**
* A desire to learn and to have an impact on Nordea's future and, understand the impact of efficient data management on business.
* Strong collaboration skills and stakeholder management: and the ability to translate, operationalize and communicate data governance terms and concepts to the Data Owners.
* Hands-on and have an ability to plan own and others' work in data governance and are results-oriented.
* Operational and have a strong drive and the ability to see what needs to be done, both in the short and long term, with a solution-oriented mindset
* Good analytics skills and a structured and methodical approach to tasks.
* The ability to take both a high-level view and to pay attention to details.
* Good English skills, both written and orally.


**Your experience and background:**
* You have a minimum of 6 months relevant experience working with data in business or data governance related role (or course-equivalent).
* Experience with operational data management preferred. This could include hands on experience as a data steward, or in a back-office role.
* Experience working with data and data models preferred.
* Knowledge of savings products and business model is an advantage.


 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 31/01/2025 . The interviews will be held on an ongoing basis, so we urge candidates to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 For more information, you’re welcome to contact Clara San Inocencio (clara.san.inocencio@nordea.com).
   

  

**For candidates in Sweden only:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Engineering Manager Applications
description:
*Would you like to take part in transforming healthcare? Qbtech is the global market leader in professional ADHD tests, providing tests that are both CE marked and FDA cleared for use as an aid in the assessment and treatment evaluation of ADHD for people age 6-60. Our vision is to transform healthcare by providing a complete system of leading objective tests, products and services that empowers clinical and financial decision-makers to improve outcomes and support patients to better understand their symptoms and treatment.*
*Qbtech is present in 14 countries with offices in Stockholm, London and Houston. Over the next years, Qbtech will make significant investments into new products, technologies and people to further strengthen their services and product offerings with the aim of building an ecosystem with solutions for providers, clinicians and patients.*
**About The Role**
 As Engineering Manager, you will have complete responsibility for leading and managing a team of Frontend Engineers, driving the development of our web and mobile applications. In this role, you’ll combine leadership with hands-on contributions in close collaboration with the team, supporting the team’s progress both strategically and operationally.
   

  

 Responsibilities include, but are not limited to
   

  

* Lead team growth, performance, and collaboration to build a strong engineering culture.
* Uphold engineering excellence by refining workflows, ensuring security, and fostering accountability.
* Build, review, and maintain software architecture and deployment.


**Who are you?**
 We believe that you are a thoughtful and driven leader with a strong ability to support and empower your team. Structured and solution-oriented, you approach challenges with confidence and guide your team toward success. Collaboration and communication are central to your leadership style, ensuring alignment and fostering a productive environment.
   

  

 With a focus on strategy and execution, you divide your time between setting the team’s direction and actively contributing to deliver impactful results, ensuring both the broader vision and the finer details are addressed.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* A degree in software engineering, computer science or a related field.
* Extensive client applications (Web or Mobile) software development skills, preferably with cross-platform development
* Proven experience in a leadership role
* Proven record of designing and implementing technical solutions
* Experience in leading teams through transformation processes
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


*If you have prior experience from companies working in industries with high security requirements or from med-tech, it is highly meritorious.*
**What can Qbtech offer you?**
 At Qbtech you will have the opportunity to work with something meaningful that helps people understand ADHD while transforming healthcare. You will work in an international environment together with some of the leading experts in the world. You will lead the development of best in class as well as first in class products and services – globally. There are plenty of opportunities to learn and grow and to expand into other technologies within the company. Qbtech also offers education and certifications in fields that are relevant to the technology used within the company.

title: Product Manager - Anbox
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Canonical's product management team are technologists who have a passion for delivering products and solutions that help shape market demands while elevating open source software everywhere. This is an application track for a product management position at Canonical on Anbox Cloud. Apply here if you excel at leadership, communication, and technical vision, and believe you can drive product strategy for the business needs of tomorrow.
   

  

 We believe that open source is transforming the way that enterprises solve their business needs. Although open source has been around for thirty years, it is only now fundamental to every corner of the software landscape. Going forward we believe open source will have an even bigger impact as it moves into specialised vertical markets. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of 'most software to most companies', starting with Ubuntu but expanding to cover every class of application on every class of compute. To deliver on that ambition, we select product managers for their intellect and strong drive to advance the open source community. Together, we aim to improve open source quality, outreach, and impact. Our product managers set the vision and the direction to ensure teams deliver the right products in the right markets at the right time. They push the boundaries of the technology landscape to identify and deliver products into new and existing market opportunities.
   

  

 Ubuntu is the world's favourite Linux, used by developers around the world. Canonical has created a line of products and services that address primary challenges for those developing and deploying software. If you have a passion for cloud gaming, containerization and virtualization, then you will love being part of our team.
   

  

 This is an exceptional opportunity for a competitive technology leader to:
   

  

* Lead the roadmap of Anbox Cloud features and drive our strategy of Android virtualization and containerization
* Work with our engineering team to shape the development roadmap for Anbox Cloud
* Define future business models taking into account the competitive landscape
* Engage with the cloud gaming ecosystem and leading customers, enabling commercial success and driving go-to-market


 This role encompasses product leadership and go-to-market strategy, ensuring that the product vision is translated into actionable plans and successful market launches. Our product managers are technology professionals with a software engineering background who strive to become business executives and entrepreneurs. We discuss strategy, plan product development, drive engagement, and promote the open source way. We oversee the entire product lifecycle from conception to delivery, blending technical expertise, strategic thinking, analytics, project management skills and effective communication to ensure products meet both user needs and business objectives.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Lead the product development lifecycle, reviewing the priorities and goals for your product.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as engineering, design, marketing, and sales.
* Address common challenges across projects, align on priorities, enable informed decisions, and keep business execution on track.
* Conduct market research, analyse industry trends, and gather customer feedback to identify opportunities.
* Communicate your product vision, status updates, and key decisions to ensure alignment and manage expectations.
* Conduct usability testing, analyse user feedback, and iterate on the product to improve the user experience.
* Collaborate with marketing, sales, and support teams to develop go-to-market strategies, create product documentation, and provide training.
* Contribute to the success of our sales team in winning new opportunities, reviewing customer feedback and participating in customer meetings.


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic results at high school and university
* Understanding of Linux and the wider open source software community
* Understanding of computer architecture, application development, data centers, cloud or devices
* Passion to write about technologies and the tech landscape
* A strong work ethic, and personal interests aligned with the open source movement
* Curiosity, and the habit of continuous learning
* A strong sense of ownership
* Problem solving and the ability to innovate
* Outstanding communication skills in English, both verbal and written
* Ability to travel internationally up to 4 times a year for company events up to two weeks long


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* Familiarity with a particular verticals (e.g. Telco, Finance, Industrial, Automotive)
* Familiarity with the technology ecosystem including Silicon, IHV, ISV, ODM/OEMs, cloud service providers and channel
* Familiarity with cloud native technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker containers & Snaps
* Familiarity with embedded and connected device technology and ecosystems
* Familiarity with networking technologies - ethernet, IPv4 and IPv6, routing, firewalling, overlays such as OVN/OVS, VPNs, SR-IOV, Infiniband
* Familiarity with Linux containerization and virtualization, including LXD and docker
* Familiarity with low latency streaming infrastructures, GPU architectures, and cloud gaming technologies
* Familiarity with Android, its components and its maintenance


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Konsult inom IAM
description:
Vi på
 **Zyense** 
 söker nu en
 **Senior konsult inom IAM-området** 
 som vill vara med och göra skillnad i en värld där säkerhet aldrig har varit viktigare. Vi söker därför etablerade IAM-experter som vill bli nyckelspelare inom ett område som konstant växer och som vill vara med och utveckla Zyense IAM-erbjudande till nya nivåer. Hos oss får du möjlighet att använda din expertis och kreativitet för att hjälpa våra kunder att bygga trygga och hållbara säkerhetslösningar. Våra kunder är verksamma i en uppsjö av spännande branscher, som exempelvis: bank, finans och försäkring, offentlig sektor, telekom och industri.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du Har Minst 5 Års Erfarenhet Inom IAM (IGA, PAM Etc) Och En Stark Vilja Att Göra Skillnad Och Tycker Att Det Är Kul Och Inspirerande Att Arbeta Hos Spännande Kunder. Du Kommer Att Arbeta i Kundprojekt Som Bl.a Kan Komma Att Innebära Att Du; Själv Eller Tillsammans Med Andra Kollegor Kartlägger Och Analyserar Befintliga IT-miljö Och Är Rådgivande Vid Val Av Lösningar, Omvandlar Krav Och Behov Till Förstklassig Arkitektur Och IAM-lösningar (SSO, MFA, API, OAuth Etc). Du Ger Konsultativ Rådgivning Och Arbetar Praktiskt Med Allt Som Rör Design Och Implementation. Uppdragen Kan Även Innebära Att Du Är Ansvarig För Att Utveckla Befintliga IAM-lösningar (risk- Och Sårbarhetsanalyser Etc). Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har Erfarenhet Av Några Av Följande Områden
   

  

* IT-infrastruktur/IaaS
* Azure AD/Entra, AWS IAM, Google Cloud IAM, Okta eller någon annan central spelare på marknaden.


 Det är en fördel om du även har lite erfarenhet av ledande informationssäkerhets-standarder/regelverk
   

  

* ISO27000
* NIST
* GDPR
* NIS2
* DORA
* ISF


 Som person är du initiativtagande, social och kreativ – men samtidigt ödmjuk och lyhörd. Du trivs med att samarbeta, bygga relationer och skapa värde för våra kunder. Dessa egenskaper tror vi är centrala för att du på bästa sätt ska kunna förstå kundens krav och behov, komma med kreativa och kvalitativa lösningar och förankra dessa i organisationen.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 På Zyense får du chansen att bli en del av ett företag där vi värdesätter personlig utveckling, nyfikenhet och samarbete. Vi arbetar i en platt organisation där det är högt i tak, och vi strävar alltid efter att ligga steget före inom cybersäkerhet. Du får möjlighet att påverka hur vi ska utveckla våra leveranser mot kund och säkerställa att vi håller högsta möjliga kvalitet. Hos oss är ingen dag den andra lik, och vi lovar dig både utmaningar och möjligheter att växa – både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Skicka in din ansökan och låt oss ta ett samtal om hur vi tillsammans kan skapa framtidens cybersäkerhet.

title: Microsoft Dynamics Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Outsourcing and Offshoring Consulting
description:
Senior Microsoft Dynamics 365 Consultant - BC/NAV
 



  





 Company:
 



  





 My client is regularly recognised as one of the best to work for in Sweden. Having won numerous awards as both an employer and for their services and results, they offer end-to-end solutions and dedicated teams to work with some of the biggest customers on the most innovative and exciting Dynamics 365 BC/NAV projects in the region.
 



  





 Role:
 



  





 As a Microsoft Dynamics BC/NAV Consultant you will be responsible for engagements such as the deployment, configuration and development of customised solutions. There are requirements for both Technical Consultants to be hands-on with the technical delivery as well as more business or functional Consultant roles. By joining at the beginning of this journey, you will also play an instrumental role in achieving the growth aspirations and firmly establishing the organisation as one of the leading Microsoft ERP Partners in the region.
 



  





 The opportunities are largely based in Stockholm or Malmo with visibility to customers when required.
 



  





 Required skills:
 



  




* Hands on experience of Dynamics 365 BC or NAV with a track record leading and delivering projects.
* Either Consulting experience or strong experience in a Dynamics 365 BC or NAV focused role for a large/enterprise organisation.
* Relevant Dynamics and/or Azure certifications are advantageous.
* Fluent English and Swedish language skills are essential.



  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Since 2014, Acast has been creating the world’s most valuable podcast marketplace, building the technology which connects podcast creators, advertisers and listeners. Its marketplace spans more than 135,000 podcasts, 2,700 advertisers and c.1 billion quarterly listens.
   

  

 Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen - across any podcasting app or other listening platform. The company operates worldwide and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. Acast is listed on the Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In just a few seconds, Acast’s Dynamic Ad Insertion platform dynamically sources, selects, and splices ads into uniquely personalised streams for millions of listens every day, all while optimising towards the best possible return for the creator, advertiser, and of course the listener themselves.
   

  

 As the Engineering Manager for Ad Delivery, you’ll be working on Acast’s own ad server, integrations with third-party ad servers, and our rapidly evolving yield optimisation platform to make the most of every listen and campaign. To do this you’ll also be tapping into Acast’s audience indexing and contextual targeting capabilities, owning and managing our monetisation management tools, and providing core business data sources to teams around Acast to enable payouts, insights, and metrics.
   

  

 Your responsibilities are to ensure sustainable successful delivery of your team’s products, through your own direct contribution, team leadership, and management of team processes and planning. Through a tight collaboration with your partner Product Manager, you will be the engine of progress towards the goal of matching as much monetisable inventory with the best possible ads in the most valuable manner possible.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
 You’ll directly manage a highly skilled and experienced team of software and data engineers, distributed across Europe. You’ll be responsible for their individual growth and performance on an ongoing basis, providing frequent feedback, solid development plans, and insightful reviews. You’ll work with your team every day, and sync with them individually every week, building a close relationship based on trust to help everyone do their best work.
   

  

 You’ll elevate your team to take ownership and exercise autonomy judiciously in order to best deliver against the team’s objectives, but also be ready to step forward and lead directly when needed. You will organise the team’s work and staffing to match capacity against demand, ensuring its long-term health and effectiveness. You’ll think creatively when approaching ambitious goals across a wide range of product capabilities so that progress is made in a sustainable, lean manner, nurturing just enough process to do the job well.
   

  

 Working as a member of the team, you will directly contribute to the development of the team’s tech stack, in whichever form best suits your skillset and needs of the day. Whether you’re writing code, testing features, handling operations, or supporting colleagues from around the business, we believe engineering leaders are most effective when they’re hands-on day-to-day. You’ll contribute to the design of systems and architectures, and work alongside other engineering leads and senior engineering staff to produce solutions spanning the entire Acast platform.
   

  

 Stellar results require close, productive collaboration between people and teams, which you will take a front seat in facilitating. You’ll readily develop relationships across teams, knowing the best people to include at the right moment. You’ll foster an open and productive dialogue between your team and their stakeholders, inside and out, ensuring that we deliver the right thing, on time, on a stable and scalable foundation.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You will have a past where you’ve “done it all” - from building small features through to designing architectures, you’ll know what it takes to produce great software. You will have experience of developing and maintaining large back-end architectures designed for scale and high availability, and have actively supported operations both in- and out-of-hours. At heart you’ll still be an engineer excited by new tools and techniques, but have the experience to understand how and when to introduce them.
   

  

 You may not have managed people directly before but you will have been a leader amongst your peers. You’re used to being the most senior or experienced engineer in the room most of the time, but know how to leave space for others and amplify their ideas. You’ll feel equally comfortable working with a junior engineer in their first role, or a staff engineer with decades under their belt. You’ll bring empathy, a healthy balance of critical and supportive engagement to the work of others, and a positive mindset to motivate those around you.
   

  

 Communication will probably be your strongest skill, knowing how to bring people in with honesty, clarity, and accuracy - whether you’re explaining tech to non-technical senior leadership or debugging production software with engineers.
   

  

 The role of Engineering Manager leans on a huge range of skills, applied in a diverse set of contexts. You will relish an opportunity to do new things but also act as the servant leader, readily taking on the work that is needed most, not just the most appealing. You will know how to grow yourself and others, and enjoy the variety of the role over time. You’ll improve the groups you work within by amplifying their strengths while filling the gaps. Most of all, you’ll want to do the best job you can, and help others do the same.
   

  

**Plus Points In Experience Include**
 Cloud architecture (particularly AWS), TypeScript, online ad industry standards (VAST, OpenRTB), back-end service development, high-volume API development, serverless batch processing, devops.
   

  

**Where you will be**
 The team works remotely for the most part, with members based in a few European countries and a concentration in Stockholm where in-person collaboration is possible in our offices. The “core hours” for team collaboration are generally 1000-1600 CET.
   

  

**Culture & DEI**
 Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.
   

  

 Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We’re global and have remote teams, so it’s even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome.
   

  

 We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.
   

  

 We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!

title: CTO Business Management Partner
description:
**Job ID:
 **28477****
 Do you want to make a difference at the heart of Nordea’s technology organisation?
   

  

 Leverage your strategic mindset, strong interpersonal skills, and business understanding to bridge operational and strategic priorities within the Nordea CTO organisation. Join us as a CTO Business Management Partner to play a pivotal role in supporting the CTO management team, fostering collaboration, and enabling the success of the CTO organisation. If you are ready to make a positive difference, continue reading and apply today for an exciting career opportunity shaped around your unique potential.
   

  

 Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.
   

  

 We are looking for three full-time CTO Business Management Partners to join our small but impactful team. This gives us the unique opportunity to build the team with complementary profiles. So please apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements; you might be the perfect puzzle piece we need.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank; we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the CTO Business Management team. Our role is to enable the success of Nordea’s CTO organisation by bridging strategic and operational initiatives, fostering collaboration across stakeholders, and driving change through innovative and effective solutions.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Act as a trusted strategic partner to the CTO leadership team, supporting key decisions and driving initiatives to achieve Nordea’s goals
* Build and maintaining strong professional relationships across Nordea, primarily in Technology, fostering collaboration and engagement with diverse set of stakeholders
* Manage and deliver strategic initiatives from concept to completion, ensuring outcomes meet high-quality standards and deadlines
* Contribute to a positive and people-focused culture, fostering teamwork, creativity, and continuous improvement across the organisation


**Who You Are**
 This is the right role for you if you enjoy collaborating with people and get energy from your colleagues. You thrive in dynamic environments and enjoy working on a mix of long-term initiatives and ad hoc challenges. If you’re seeking a role that you can co-define together with the team this role is for you.
   

  

**Your background and skills include:**
* Exceptional interpersonal and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to navigating complexity and collaborate across diverse levels and teams
* Strategic thinker with exceptional problem-solving skills
* Strong communicator with the ability to engage, influence, and align stakeholders effectively and with a talent for simplifying complex topics for diverse audiences
* You have a creative mindset and are passionate about driving positive change
* Proven experience in either strategic planning, project management or business support roles, preferably in large and/or complex organisations
* Strong execution skills, with a track record of delivering high-quality initiatives within set timelines
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken


**It would be ideal if you also have:**
* Technical knowledge or experience within Technology, preferably within infrastructure or other CTO areas
* Experience in some of the following: reporting, organising, cultural initiatives, facilitating workshops, strategy creation, or event planning


**Locations:** 
 Stockholm, Helsinki, Tri-city or Warsaw.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next Steps**
 Are you ready to help shape the future of Nordea Technology CTO? Apply now and showcase your experience creatively – submit your CV and cover letter no later than 16/02/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Erika Klavint, erika.klavint@nordea.com. Please note that we will start interviews already before job opening closes.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

 People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

 A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

 Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
   

  

**For candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
   

  

**For candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**For candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: IT-specialist/ IT-infrastrukturtekniker sökes för konsultuppdragort
description:
Du kommer att arbeta med teknisk kravställning, systemkonfiguration och IT-säkerhet, samt stödja verksamheten i digitaliseringsprojekt.
   

  

 Digitaliseringsenheten hos vår kund har i uppdrag att leverera en tillgänglig och säker drift av system och central infrastruktur samt förvalta och utveckla den IT-nära delen av applikationer/system och IT-infrastrukturtjänster.
   

  

 Tjänsten som
 **IT-specialist och IT-infrastrukturtekniker** 
 är tvådelad:
   

  

* Som IT-specialist kommer du att verka i objektsförvaltningen där du hjälper objektledare med teknisk systemförvaltning. Du stöttar verksamheter med teknisk rådgivning och dialog med systemleverantörer.
* Som IT-infrastrukturtekniker arbetar du med infrastrukturtjänster där du både beställer den teknik som verksamheten behöver och ansvarar för kravställning på leverantörer. Du kommer även att ansvara för vissa centrala IT-tjänster och system. Vilka tjänster som kommer att falla under ditt ansvar bestäms i samråd med dig och övriga inom IT-infrastrukturgruppen, baserat på tidigare erfarenheter, behov och vad du tycker skulle vara utmanande och givande.


**I rollen ingår bland annat:**
* Ansvar för att säkerställa de tekniska förutsättningarna för verksamhetens system, exempelvis beställning av servrar och applikationspaketering.
* Förvaltning och utveckling av centrala IT-tjänster/system.
* Skapande och underhåll av systemskisser samt införande och utveckling av system.
* Teknisk dialog med leverantörer, kravställning och förändringshantering.
* 3rd line-support och avancerad felsökning.
* Arbeta med IT-säkerhetsrelaterade aktiviteter och identifiering av risker.
* Teknisk konfiguration av system samt framtagning av specifikationer och beställningar för exempelvis integrationer och rapporter.


**Är det här du?**
 Du har gedigen kunskap inom IT-infrastruktur och trivs med att hjälpa verksamheter att på bästa sätt införa IT-system för att främja fortsatt digitalisering. Du har lätt för att förstå kundernas verksamhetsbehov och kan omsätta dem i teknisk konfiguration.
   

  

 Du förstår komplexa IT-miljöer och deras komponenter såsom katalogtjänster, IT-infrastruktur, nätverk, servrar, databaser och klientapplikationer och ser IT-säkerhet som en självklarhet i alla
   

  

 Du är en strukturerad problemlösare med förmåga att hantera flera parallella uppgifter. Du trivs med att arbeta i team och delar gärna information och kunskap med kollegor.
   

  

**Erfarenhet och kompetens**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av tekniskt operativt arbete i komplexa IT-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av kravställning och teknisk dialog med leverantörer.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


 Du har dessutom goda kunskaper och arbetserfarenhet inom flertalet av följande områden:
   

  

* Microsoft infrastruktursystem såsom AD, DNS, SQL, PKI, IIS.
* Nätverk, klienthantering och printmiljöer.
* Microsoft Onlinetjänster och Azure.
* Förvaltningsmodeller som PM3 eller likvärdig modell.
* Scripting, SQL-frågor, API-anrop och LDAP-frågor.
* Drift och förvaltning av IT-system.

title: Product Information Manager
description:
*Looking for a role where you can manage product data and improve processes? Join us as a Product Information Manager and work with global teams to keep our product information accurate and up to date!* 




  





**AddSecure** 
 is a leading European provider of secure IoT connectivity and end-to-ends solutions. We help customers optimize their operations, drive business value, and secure vital functions.
 
 Our business unit Smart Alarms offers secure solutions for monitored alarm transmission as well as reliable crisis communication solutions that help organizations and rescue teams to prevent and respond to an emergency.
 



  





 AddSecure is on a mission to create a safer and smarter world. We are seeking a Product Information Manager to join our Product Operations & Scale-up Team. In this pivotal role, you will ensure our product data is accurate, consistent, and securing order to invoice flow with great customer experience.
 



  





**About the job** 




 As a Product Information Manager, you will be responsible for managing product data across AddSecure’s channels. You’ll work closely with Product Managers, Sales, and Marketing to ensure that all product information is accurate, up to date, and aligned with business goals. Your main tasks:
 


* Keep product data complete and accurate in Salesforce, Navision, SharePoint, Business Central, and other platforms.
* Act as the super-user for product information tools, helping teams manage and update data.
* Work with finance, tech, and business teams to ensure smooth product launches and order processing.
* Use data insights to improve processes and suggest better ways of working.
* Train and support colleagues in using product information systems.
* Collaborate with global teams to keep product information clear and accessible worldwide.



  





**About you** 




 To thrive and succeed in this role, you should:
 


* Have a degree in business, data management, IT, or a similar field.
* Have experience with product information systems, ideally in IoT, tech, or manufacturing.
* Be a team player who enjoys working with others.
* Be proactive and focused on results.
* Have strong system skills and experience with tools like Salesforce, Navision, or similar platforms.
* You understand the overall vision but also pay close attention to details.
* Speak and write fluent Swedish and English.



  





**We offer** 




 Our employees are our greatest asset and for us it is of great importance to build a culture where our employees thrive and want to perform. You will be part of a motivated team in an international company. In addition, we offer:
 


* A dynamic workplace where innovation meets collaboration.
* A hybrid working model, allowing flexibility between home and office work.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.



  





**We're all change makers!** 




 If you seek a company that encourages you to be yourself and to have fun at work, where your work contributes to a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world, then AddSecure might be your destination. Join our growing international team, where each day is an opportunity to make a real difference.
 



 Would you like to take part in our journey? learn more about us and this position when you click on "Apply"

title: Cybersecurity Embedded Solution Architect- Gothenburg, On-Site
description:
**Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a** 
**Cybersecurity Embedded Solution Architect**
* Location: Gothenburg, Sweden (On-site, 100%).
* Job Type: Fulltime


**We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Cybersecurity Embedded Solution Architect** 
 to join our client team in the automotive industry and contribute to a large-scale embedded software project for a client in the automotive industry.
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Cybersecurity Embedded Solution Architect
   

  

**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 You will be working on a
 **large-scale embedded software project for a client in the automotive industry** 
 . Your role involves
 **software development, integration, and cybersecurity architecture** 
 for embedded platforms. This position offers exciting challenges, working in close collaboration with
 **suppliers, development teams, and architecture groups** 
 to ensure the best cybersecurity solutions are implemented.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and integrate cybersecurity solutions for embedded software platforms.
* Work closely with suppliers and internal development teams to ensure seamless integration.
* Define system specifications and coordinate between different stakeholders.
* Implement on-board cybersecurity solutions, including Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) and Public Key Infrastructure (PKI).
* Work with real-time embedded systems and optimize cybersecurity features.
* Utilize Linux (Yocto) for Embedded Linux environments.
* Develop software using C and C++ for complex embedded system solutions.
* Collaborate on automation, CI/CD, and DevOps strategies.


**Requirements**
* Strong experience in Cybersecurity for Embedded Software.
* Extensive experience with Embedded Linux (Yocto preferred).
* Excellent programming skills in C and/or C++.
* Experience working with complex embedded system design.
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD environments, GIT, Jenkins, and Artifactory.
* Experience in working closely with suppliers and internal teams.


**Beneficial Qualifications**
* Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent.
* Experience working with real-time embedded systems.
* Familiarity with Hypervisor, Adaptive AUTOSAR, Embedded Linux Kernel.
* Knowledge of Agile development methodologies.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

**Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at sandhya@vipas.se**
**Note:** 
 Please do apply if you have
 **Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.**
**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Chef inom systemutveckling
description:
Motiveras du av att se andra växa och att leda team i förändring? Som sektionschef på Skatteverkets it-avdelning har du en avgörande roll i vår digitaliseringsresa, och du får vara med och göra samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som chef och ledare på Skatteverket ser du till helheten, skapar förutsättningar och agerar medvetet i vardagen. Tillsammans med andra arbetar du för att skapa värde med fokus på kunden, med grund i vårt samhällsbärande uppdrag. I ditt ledarskap möjliggör du utveckling och lärande genom att ge mandat och skapa stort handlingsutrymme; du förstärker och följer upp de beteenden och den kultur som behövs för att vi tillsammans ska kunna genomföra vårt uppdrag. Du förväntas agera och leda även om svaren inte är givna, vägvalen inte tydliga och arbetssätten inte självklara. Med mod och insikt utmanar du våra invanda tankesätt och arbetssätt och är själv öppen för att låta dig utmanas.
   

  

 Vi söker en chef till vår sektion som levererar lösningar för gemensamma tjänster som främst nyttjas av andra utvecklingsvärdeströmmar. Sektionen har fokus på att leverera arkiveringslösningar till både Skatteverket och våra anslutna myndigheter.
   

  

 Som sektionschef har du medarbetaransvar. Det innebär att du har den dagliga dialogen med sektionens medarbetare, genomför avstämnings- och uppföljningssamtal, arbetar med medarbetarnas arbetsmiljö och kompetensutveckling m.m. Du har också ansvar för utveckling, drift och stöd för de lösningar sektionen utvecklar, samt ingår i enhetens ledningsgrupp och rapporterar till enhetschefen.
   

  

 Inom Skatteverket jobbar vi agilt med stöd av ramverket SAFe och vi nyttjar nya tekniker och moderna utvecklingsplattformar för att effektivt skapa värde för våra kunder. Du har en viktig roll att driva arbetet framåt inom dessa områden.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha förmåga att se helheten med fokus på kundvärde
* ha förmåga att skapa rätt förutsättningar utifrån din förståelse för verksamhet och uppdrag
* ha förmåga att agera medvetet i vardagen utifrån en god självinsikt
* kunna hantera och analysera informationsflöden, se samband, avgränsa och förmedla information
* ha förmåga att kommunicera tydligt och skapa ett klimat där vi lyssnar på varandra.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* en högskoleutbildning om 180hp/120p inom it/datavetenskap eller annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivare bedömer som relevant
* flerårig och relevant erfarenhet inom systemutveckling
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla verksamhet och medarbetare
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet leda medarbetare och konsulter med hög teknisk kompetens


 Det är önskvärt att du har aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet från myndighet, erfarenhet av personal- och budgetansvar, samt erfarenhet av offentliga upphandlingar och leverantörsstyrning. Det är också önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av SAFe.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader. Förordnandet som chef är tidsbegränsat till max fem år, med möjlighet till förlängning.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, vår syn på ledarskap och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/85 | Kontakt: Nicole Mattsson, Hr-specialist nicole.mattsson@skatteverket.se, Lena Mahlberg, Rekryterande chef lena.mahlberg@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-01-31 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-02-28

title: Account Executive
description:
**About Us**
 Are you ready to be part of history? At Telgea.com, we are revolutionising the mobile communication industry, by building the world's first and only global mobile carrier company. As Account Executive , you will play a pivotal role in helping businesses manage mobile plans across the globe, setting global communication free.
   

  

 Read here about what we achieved in just 6 months: https://t.ly/fEfe2
   

  

**The role**
 Your role is to help solve mid-level enterprise’s telecom pains by showing them how Telgea makes connectivity across borders seamless and efficient. You’ll own the entire sales cycle, from prospecting to closing, and play an essential role in driving our growth.
   

  

 If you are an experienced B2B salesperson who thrives on building relationships, closing deals, and collaborating with a team, there is a big opportunity waiting for you!
   

  

 At Telgea, your resilience and skills will be rewarded with competitive compensation, uncapped bonuses, and a journey few ever experience.
   

  

**To Impress Us, You**
* Take ownership of the entire sales funnel, from prospecting leads to negotiating and closing deals.
* Understand Telgea’s value proposition and effectively communicate it to IT managers and champions.
* Collaborate with teammates to identify creative ways to exceed sales targets.
* Consistently track your sales activities in HubSpot to manage pipelines effectively.


**To Be Promoted, You**
* Continuously expand your knowledge of Telgea’s solutions and the B2B telecom industry.
* Not only meet but exceed your monthly and annual sales targets.
* Demonstrate the skills and mindset needed to step into a leadership role.


**Who You Are**
 You can share at least one reference demonstrating your success in account-based selling or multi-stakeholder B2B deals. You have experience working with businesses in the 50-1,000 employee range and understand the importance of building trust in the sales processes.
   

  

**Your Friends Agree That You Are**
* A great communicator and listener
* Highly competitive
* Approachable and trustworthy
* Persistent and resourceful


**Your Former Colleagues Agree That You Are**
* Confident in high-stakes negotiations
* Resilient in the face of rejection
* A proactive problem-solver
* Collaborative and a team player


**You Agree On The Following About Yourself**
* I thrive in fast-paced, results-oriented environments.
* I’m motivated by closing deals and helping clients succeed.
* I’m eager to learn new skills and technologies to improve my performance.
* I value constructive feedback and use it to grow professionally.
* I enjoy being part of a team that works hard and celebrates success together.


**Why Join Us**
* Enjoy a competitive OTE of 100,000 USD (1/3 Fixed) and uncapped bonuses.
* Join a sales team where your contributions are directly tied to the company’s growth.
* Work with talented individuals who hold themselves and each other to high standards.
* Participate in optional full-company trips four times a year to connect and collaborate with teammates.
* Work with autonomy and flexibility, blending work and personal life seamlessly.
* Be part of a fast-growing company at the forefront of telecom innovation, delivering impactful solutions to global businesses.
* Become a shareholder by earning monthly company shares.


**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden

title: Sektionschef inom Nät & Kommunikation
description:
**Vill du ha ett meningsfullt arbete och bidra till ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld?**
 Det förändrade omvärldsläget medför att vårt försvar behöver förstärkas och den ökade underrättelseverksamheten mot Sverige och Försvarsmakten är omfattande. Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) bedriver försvarsunderrättelseverksamhet och militär underrättelse-och säkerhetstjänst till stöd för svensk utrikes-, försvars- och säkerhetspolitik samt i övrigt för kartläggning av yttre hot mot Sverige.
   

  

*Vi söker nu en sektionschef som trivs med att arbeta i en chefsbefattning där fokus ligger på det utvecklande ledarskapet, där du genom engagemang för var och en av dina medarbetare driver verksamheten framåt avseende både utveckling och förvaltning av nät och kommunikationslösningar.*
**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder ett viktigt och stimulerande arbete där du dagligen bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet. Vi erbjuder också goda möjligheter till komptensutveckling. Hos oss finns det friskvårdsmöjligheter som inkluderar träning tre timmar i veckan på arbetstid samt möjlighet till balans mellan fritid och arbete.
   

  

 Sektionens uppdrag initieras genom nära dialog med verksamheten avseende verksamhetens behov. Vidare är det av vikt att sektionen håller sig uppdaterad vad gäller omvärldsbevakning inom eget ansvarsområde, i syfte att identifiera eventuell teknik ni kan dra nytta av.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Som sektionschef är du en arbetsgivarföreträdare och utövar arbetsgivarens rättigheter/skyldigheter. Du leder, organiserar och utvecklar arbetet inom eget ansvarsområde omfattade bl.a.:
   

  

 Du är en företrädare för arbetsgivarens vision, mission, strategi, värderingar och arbetssätt
   

  

 Ansvar för sektionens verksamhet, budget och personal
   

  

 Du är en del av, och bidrar konstruktivt i ledningsgruppsarbete tillsammans med andra sektionschefer för att sätta gemensamma mål på längre sikt
   

  

 Ansvar för kompetensförsörjningen vid sektionen, vilket inkluderar
 *Attrahera* 
 ,
 *Rekrytera* 
 ,
 *Utveckla* 
 , följa upp/
 *Behålla* 
 och vid behov
 *Avveckla* 
 personal
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Förmåga och dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda, motivera och skapa resultat genom andra
   

  

 Kunskap om nuvarande- samt intresse för framtida teknik inom nät & kommunikation och hur denna kan öka kundnyttan
   

  

 Förmåga att kommunicera utveckling- och driftrelaterade ärenden med motparter som har begränsad teknisk förståelse
   

  

 Förståelse för helheten vid sidan av de tekniska detaljerna
   

  

 Kan uttrycka sig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Erfarenhet av personal- och budgetansvar
   

  

 Goda insikter kring förändringsledarskapets olika dimensioner
   

  

 God kunskap och erfarenhet av att leda införandeprojekt
   

  

 God kännedom om drift, förvaltning och utveckling inom nät och kommunikation
   

  

 Brett kontaktnät inom Försvarsmakten och/eller annan närliggande myndighet
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 För att trivas i rollen som sektionschef vet vi att du behöver vara både självgående och strukturerad. Vidare tror vi att du har en god initiativförmåga och kommunicerar på ett konstruktivt och tydligt sätt, samtidigt som du relaterar till dina medarbetare och kollegor lyhört och smidigt. Du leder, motiverar och förser andra med befogenheter för att effektivt nå gemensamma mål. Du skapar engagemang och delaktighet.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Ovan ställda kvalifikationer ska på begäran kunna verifieras genom intyg, referenser samt arbets- eller urvalstester.
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, inleds med provanställning om sex månader
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Sysselsättningsgrad: Heltid
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

**För upplysningar om befattningen eller rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**
 hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se, vänligen skriv ”Sektionschef inom Nät & Kommunikation” i ämnesraden.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Fackliga repr. nås via hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se
   

  

*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan* 
*senast 2025-02-28. Din ansökan ska innehålla cv samt ett personligt brev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för befattningen ifråga. Du ansöker via* 
*jobb.forsvarsmakten.se*
**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) är en del av Försvarsmaktens högkvarter i Stockholm. Vi ger regeringen och Försvarsmakten kvalificerade beslutsunderlag om omvärldsutvecklingen och hot mot Sveriges och Försvarsmaktens säkerhet. Vår vision är ”Ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld”. Must är en kunskapsorganisation och erbjuder både spännande och för Sverige angelägna arbetsuppgifter. Här arbetar både officerare och civila experter inom olika områden, t ex statsvetenskap, IT, ekonomi, teknik, matematik och HR. En stor del av Must verksamhet omfattas av sekretess och vi ber dig därför att inte berätta att du sökt jobb hos Must för andra personer än dina närmaste. Läs gärna mer om Must och vår verksamhet här Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Chef inom systemutveckling och webb
description:
Motiveras du av att se andra växa och att leda team i förändring? Som sektionschef på Skatteverkets it-avdelning har du en avgörande roll i vår digitaliseringsresa, och du får vara med och göra samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som chef och ledare på Skatteverket ser du till helheten, skapar förutsättningar och agerar medvetet i vardagen. Tillsammans med andra arbetar du för att skapa värde med fokus på kunden, med grund i vårt samhällsbärande uppdrag. I ditt ledarskap möjliggör du utveckling och lärande genom att ge mandat och skapa stort handlingsutrymme; du förstärker och följer upp de beteenden och den kultur som behövs för att vi tillsammans ska kunna genomföra vårt uppdrag. Du förväntas agera och leda även om svaren inte är givna, vägvalen inte tydliga och arbetssätten inte självklara. Med mod och insikt utmanar du våra invanda tankesätt och arbetssätt och är själv öppen för att låta dig utmanas.
   

  

 Vi söker en chef till vår sektion som levererar gemensamma lösningar för Skatteverkets digitala kundmöte/webb. Vi är i startgroparna till en förflyttning mot ett mer personaliserat och modernt kundmöte som nyttjar ny teknik. Sektionen inriktning är utveckling och förvaltning av gemensamma centrala tjänster och plattformar inom kundmötesområdet.
   

  

 Som sektionschef har du medarbetaransvar. Det innebär att du har den dagliga dialogen med sektionens medarbetare, genomför avstämnings- och uppföljningssamtal, arbetar med medarbetarnas arbetsmiljö och kompetensutveckling m.m. * flerårig och relevant erfarenhet inom systemutveckling
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla verksamhet och medarbetare
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet leda medarbetare och konsulter med hög teknisk kompetens.


 Det är önskvärt att du har aktuell och relevant erfarenhet från myndighet, erfarenhet av personal- och budgetansvar, samt erfarenhet av offentliga upphandlingar och leverantörsstyrning. Det är också önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av SAFe.

title: Content Specialist
description:
Seize the opportunity to join a rapidly growing business and take on a position with great responsibility and possibility to influence further growth – both ours and yours. We are now looking for a Content Specialist within Wind and solar to our business in Sweden.
   

  

 Fortum’s Wind and Solar business area is responsible for the development of wind and solar business. Our aim is to grow especially in our home market where conditions for wind and solar power are excellent. Wind and solar power play a crucial role in decarbonization of our societies.
   

  

 The location for this position is flexible and can be in any region of Sweden. We have offices for example in Stockholm, Östersund, Göteborg, Karlstad and Malmö.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you will be responsible for creating relevant and engaging content for various communication efforts and ensuring that Fortum's projects are communicated in a way that is rooted in the local culture and creates trust and understanding
   

  

 In the role as Content Specialist, your key tasks will be the following:
   

  

  

* Conduct research on local society and municipalities related to Fortum's wind power projects to ensure a deep local connection.
* Monitor and analyze local and regional media coverage related to Fortum's operations.
* Create content for different types of channels and activities related to Fortum's wind and solar projects.
* The job responsibilities include creating and laying out printed materials, as well as developing and updating web content.
* Compose and submit opinion pieces for local media outlets.
* Collaboration internally: Work closely with Fortum’s Corporate Relations Businesses (CRB) team to ensure that all efforts are aligned with Fortum's wind and solar communication plan, brand strategy and visual identity.


 The Fortum organization has key experts in each area of Wind and Solar (engineering, construction, operation), as well as more business-related experts (procurement, offtake, and strategy) to support you in your work. The final scope of your role in the team will be adapted based on your expertise, experience, but also your interests.
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Stakeholder Management Sweden
   

  

**About You**
 The following competences will help you to success in the role:
   

  

  

* Background in communication, PR, marketing, or a related field, with experience in the media landscape.
* A curious and skilled writer with a passion for finding engaging angles that drive engagement.
* Deep understanding of rural history, culture, and current challenges, enabling credible and engaged dialogue with the local community.
* Knowledge in design and video editing tools such as InDesign, Canva, Photoshop or similar.
* Proficiency in social media platforms, web editing tools, and related technologies.
* Fluency in Swedish and English is essential.


 Personal characteristics
   

  

  

* Communicative: Easy to communicate with multiple stakeholder groups and build relationships.
* Empathetic: Ability to understand and relate to stakeholder perspectives and needs.
* Proactive: Ability to take initiative and drive engagement activities forward.
* Flexible: Adaptable and able to manage change and different stakeholder needs


**We offer you**
 Fortum Wind & Solar is embarking on an exciting growth journey. At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 You will have first row seats to the renewables market and its dynamics through the vantage point of one of the largest energy companies in the Nordics. You will be a part of a tightly linked team and unit, that values a safe and friendly working environment, where wellbeing is emphasized. You will have the possibility to challenge yourself, to develop and learn new skills and expertise by collaborating with top experts while also bringing your own experience to the table, and to form personal connections with wonderful people.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application latest on 27th of February. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Karl-Johan Hellblom at karl-johan.hellblom@fortum.com or Recruitment Partner Lisa Kylberg at lisa.kylberg@partners.fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page.**
**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Chef IT Compliance och Risk
description:
Afa Försäkring är ett annorlunda försäkringsbolag, som drivs utan vinstsyfte, med en vision att alla ska ha en trygg vardag. Nu söker vi dig med erfarenhet av att leda och driva arbetet kring regelefterlevnad på strategisk och taktisk nivå inom IT. Vi är mitt inne i ett omfattande förändringsarbete inom IT och ska nu förstärka området kring IT compliance och risk.
 



  





 Att du samtidigt får arbetar för en god sak och skapar samhällsnytta är en bonus vi bjuder på!
 



  





**Vad du kan förvänta dig** 




  





 Du kommer ha det övergripande ansvaret att säkerställa total regelefterlevnad och riskhantering inom IT. Du kommer att leda arbetet och inspirera ditt team på tre medarbetare, samtidigt som du aktivt deltar i det operativa arbetet.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är** 




  




* Driva och utveckla arbetet med internkontroller.
* Koordinera interna och externa revisioner relaterat till IT.
* Hantera frågor kring integritetsskydd inom IT.
* Säkerställa kontinuerligt arbete med operativ risk och risksamordning för IT.
* Ansvara för extern regelbevakning i samarbete med centrala funktioner inom regelefterlevnad.
* Stötta IT-chefer med frågor inom ditt ansvarsområde.
* Tillhandahålla ledningsstöd till CIO.
* Stötta cheferna inom IT med frågor inom ansvarsområdet.
* Stödja CIO med strukturer för ledningsarbete och förbereda material för olika typer av forum och presentationer, anpassat efter målgrupp.



  





 Du har personalansvar för 3 personer, blir medlem i IT-ledningsgruppen och rapporterar till CIO. Det här är en möjlighet att hjälpa Afa att bli vassare inom IT och på att leverera vårt samhällsnyttiga uppdrag. Det vill du inte missa!
 



  





 Klicka här så möter du Kristo, vår CTO.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




  





 Du har en akademisk examen och lång erfarenhet av compliance och intern kontroll inom IT, på både strategisk, taktisk och operativ nivå. Du är van vid att leda och skapa strukturer och processer för att säkerställa att allt följer reglerna på ett effektivt och affärsmässigt sätt.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att leda och stötta på företagsledningsnivå, där du stabilt har drivit igenom förändringar inom ditt område i nära samarbete med olika intressenter.
 



  





 Du är en trygg person med förmågan att leda både strategiskt och operativt. Du har ett förtroendeingivande sätt och är duktig på att kommunicera och förklara nyttan med olika prioriteringar och vägval. Din förmåga att agera på både strategisk och operativ nivå är viktig här. Det är en stor fördel om du har erfarenhet från en regelstyrd bransch som till exempel bank, finans eller försäkring.
 



  





**Vad vi kan erbjuda** 




  





 Vi vill att du som anställd ska uppleva att du utvecklas över tid, och att du får möjlighet att bredda och fördjupa din kompetens.
 



  





 Vi arbetar aktivt för att skapa en hög trivsel och för att våra medarbetare ska ha rätt förutsättningar för sitt arbete. Som anställd hos oss får du ta del av flertalet förmåner
 



  




* Kollektivavtal med försäkringar och tjänstepension
* Tydlig balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Gratis träningspass och gym på kontoret
* Afa Fritid med allt från brädspel till fjällvandring
* Vi uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling



  





 Vårt fina kontor är beläget i centrala Stockholm, vilket är enkelt för dig som pendlar. Det finns även möjlighet att jobba hemifrån, men vi förväntar oss att man är på kontoret merparten av tiden, då en viktig del av rollen är att bygga relationer.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan** 




  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt dock senast 16 februari. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringspartner Anna Smedberg, anna.smedberg@afaforsakring.se
 



 Bakgrundskontroll blir aktuellt för slutkandidaten.
 



  





**Våra fackliga företrädare är** 




 Forena, försäkringsfacket, Benny Nyberg, telefon 08-696 46 12
 



 Akademikerföreningen, Maria Schütt, telefon 08-696 49 74
 



  





 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
 



  





**Om oss** 




  





 Afa Försäkring gör vardagen tryggare i arbetslivet. Våra försäkringar är en del av kollektivavtalen och ger ekonomiskt stöd vid sjukdom, arbetsskada, arbetsbrist, dödsfall och föräldraledighet. Vi finansierar forskning och stödjer insatser för att förebygga arbetsskador och ohälsa. På så vis bidrar vi till ett hållbart arbetsliv.
 



 Afa Försäkring ägs av Svenskt Näringsliv, LO och PTK.
 



 På jobb.afaforsakring.se kan du läsa mer och se filmer om hur det är att jobba på Afa Försäkring.
 



 Följ oss gärna via LinkedIn.

title: Strategic Product Management
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Ericsson continues to strengthen its leading position in Network Management to shape the industry. With our solution, customers experience reduced complexity, reduced cost and enablement of new opportunities to monetize their networks. We want to be recognized for differentiating the Ericsson Network Solutions, and we want our people and culture to have a deep sense of pride and a strong sense of purpose for Network Management.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of an industry leading product management team, working with specialists who build best-in-class solutions and products that are used by 300 operators in 180 countries leading the global evolution?
   

  

 We are looking for a Strategic Product Manager (SPM) to join our Network and Resource Management team. This role will require you to be the master of destiny to translate strategy into business result and to lead our customers for joint success.
   

  

 a business mindset, strategic thinking, and influential skills to continue to strengthen the Network and Resource Management offerings.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Be master of destiny by developing and executing product strategies.
* Develop and communicate value propositions
* Lead network management business based on customers, market, and the competitive landscape.
* Identify business opportunities and handle product backlog priorities.
* Lead customer collaboration and challenge status quo to develop the business in accordance with current and future customers’ needs.
* Champion stakeholders across organizations to influence stakeholders and decisions to improve business.


**The skills you bring:**
* A strong strategic mindset and ability to shape executable strategies.
* Commercial excellence with solid business and financial understanding driving decisions in P&L.
* Ability to articulate the value of a solution to customers as well as to internal technical and business stakeholders at different levels.
* Ability to effectively change direction due to new circumstances, but to keep the focus on agreed target.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication skills and ability to build networks.
* Experience in coping with complex pressures and challenges.
* Demonstrated competence in Network Management and Automation and OSS industry evolution and how to shape it.
* Demonstrated competence in supported domains (OSS, Radio, Transport and Core).


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 759381
   

  

 ]]>

title: SAP Ecosystem, Go to Market Regional Lead
description:
**Role:** 
 SAP Ecosystem, Go to Market Regional Lead
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Reports to:** 
 SAP Ecosystem, Global Go to Market Lead
 



  





**Basic Qualifications** 



* 12+ years over all work experience plus experience in SAP market and/or services market , Must HAVE SAP S4HANA services knowledge and selling experiences.
* The position, based in each respective region to operate as an overlay for the region as part of a global team/ecosystem
* Rich and diverse background and understanding of Global SAP Business, regional Market Unit, and partnership management
* Excellent follow-up, oral and written communication and presentation skills required
* Bachelor’s degree required, MBA a plus
