* Very high energy level with a positive disposition; self-starter who is customer focused
* Ability to multi-task and exhibit a high level of enthusiasm, common sense, initiative, collaboration, trust, and creativity
* Ability to exercise authority appropriately and effectively
* Ability to cross collaborate across HCL Practices, Industry units to drive synergies
* Well versed with regional SAP Market Unit structure, SAP product portfolio, SAP industry business units



  





**Job Description** 



* The candidate should possess both a business/sales background that enables them to engage at the SAP Market unit and SAP field level, and SAP regional leadership
* Must HAVE SAP S4HANA services knowledge and selling experiences
* Responsibilities within the SAP Ecosystem Role will include driving HCL Sales & SAP Field alignment across the region
* Responsibility to establish and grow business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with SAP Field, Market Units, SAP Partner management & HCL Practices
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build strong industry relationships. Interact with internal global alliance teams centrally to leverage and drive partnership excellence in the field



  





**Roles & Responsibilities** 



* Develop, define and execute joint SAP marketing and GTM programs with SAP and HCL
* Demonstrate thought leadership in driving programs, gtm plans and strategy for the region
* Drive joint business opportunities with sales, presales and leadership teams
* Drive joint Focused Partner Revenue (FPR) for SAP & licenses resell through VAR agreement
* Lead joint account collaboration
* Serve as a lead of the Business Development team in helping to define and deliver HCL overall go-to-market strategy from SAP EU perspective
* Coach, sell and influence colleagues and partner on HCL SAP EU value, offerings, solutions
* Set a strategic business development plan for EMEA and ensure it's in line with HCL strategic direction
* Manage and close a pipeline of business associated with the Partner and Internal sales teams from different LOBs
* Drive QBRs with the SAP partner management and planning for the assigned sales numbers
* Take the product proposition to the assigned markets or verticals/sub-verticals.
* Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team.



  





*HCLTech is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.* 




  





**How You’ll Grow** 




 At HCLTech, we offer continuous opportunities for you to find your spark and grow with us. We want you to be happy and satisfied with your role and to really learn what type of work sparks your brilliance the best. Throughout your time with us, we offer transparent communication with senior-level employees, learning and career development programs at every level, and opportunities to experiment in different roles or even pivot industries. We believe that you should be in control of your career with unlimited opportunities to find the role that fits you best.

title: ServiceNow GRC konsult
description:
*Är du en skicklig och ambitiös konsult med erfarenhet av risk- och säkerhetshantering? Har du en passion för teknik och vill hjälpa till att leverera innovativa lösningar via ServiceNow-plattformen? Då vill vi att du ska bli en del av teamet!* 




 \_ \_ \_ \_
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Risk & Compliance Consulting (RCC) på KPMG Advisory är ett mångsidigt team på cirka 60 kollegor med ämnes expertis inom risktransformation, regelefterlevnad, forensiska utredningar och hantering av bedrägeririsker, intern kontroll, riskhantering, internrevision och hållbarhet. Vi arbetar med ett brett spektrum av riskrådgivningstjänster och våra medarbetare har mycket olika bakgrunder, inklusive ekonomi, juridik, teknik, företagsekonomi och statsvetenskap.
 



 Vår mångfald i både människor och kompetenser gör oss till en ledande rådgivare på marknaden. Vi arbetar med högpresterande kunder inom alla sektorer, inklusive privat sektor, offentlig sektor och finansiella tjänster. En viktig del av vårt arbete är digitalisering och integrering av ny teknik för att förändra riskhanterings- och efterlevnadsprocesser för våra kunder. Vi ger råd till våra kunder i deras transformationsresor och främjar digitala, innovativa och hållbara lösningar på våra kunders affärsutmaningar.
 



  





 Vi hjälper våra kunder med rådgivning och implementering av den ledande teknikplattformen ServiceNow, för digitalisering och transformation inom våra discipliner. Våra verksamhetsområden inkluderar riskhantering, säkerhet, supply chain, HR, portföljhantering, leverantörsstyrning och utveckling av kundspecifika lösningar.
 



  





 KPMGs ServiceNow satsning är en global framgångssaga och vårt fokus på professionell expertis och domänexpertis har gjort oss till en föredragen partner, både för ServiceNow och för våra kunder. Våra insatser har uppmärksammats globalt genom att bland annat ha utsetts till ServiceNow Global Transformation Partner of the Year 2023.
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Vi söker dig som har, eller vill bygga, kompetens inom riskhantering, cybersäkerhet, regelefterlevnad, bolagsstyrning samt krisberedskap och integritet – ur ett teknik- och verktygsstödsperspektiv. Det finns mycket utrymme att växa professionellt och personligt i denna position!
 



  





 Som ServiceNow GRC konsult kommer du att;
 


* Spela en nyckelroll i att hjälpa våra kunder att stärka sin GRC-funktion (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) med hjälp av ServiceNow plattformen
* Vara involverad i olika kundengagemang inom olika branscher
* Vägleda och hjälpa kunder med råd om implementering och användning av ServiceNow inom primärt Governance Risk and Compliance
* Bidra till att utforma och anpassa lösningar som adresserar kundens behov inom risk- och säkerhetshantering, regelefterlevnad, leverantörsrisk, nödberedskap och integritet
* Samarbeta med multidisciplinära team för att säkerställa leveranser av hög kvalitet
* Vara en drivande kraft för bästa praxis och ständiga förbättringar
* Aktivt delta i utvecklingen av tjänsteområdet inom ServiceNow med innovativa lösningar på komplexa problem, och inte minst hjälpa till att bygga ett starkt cyber- och GRC-community i hela Norden och EMA



 ,
 



**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Masterexamen inom teknik, ekonomi, IT-säkerhet, samhällssäkerhet och riskhantering eller motsvarande
* 2-6 års erfarenhet inom relevanta områden som risk- och säkerhetshantering, IT-styrning eller compliance
* Praktisk erfarenhet av GRC-verktyg, särskilt ServiceNow
* God teknisk förståelse och intresse för hur teknik kan stödja affärsprocesser
* Stark kommunikationsförmåga, både på svenska och engelska



  





**Vill du göra skillnad med oss?** 




  





 Vänta inte med din ansökan eftersom vi granskar ansökningar och anställer löpande. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten, tveka inte att kontakta rekryterande chef Emil Lundvall, emil.lundvall@kpmg.se. För eventuella frågor relaterade till rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner, Susanne Hedberg, susanne.hedberg@kpmg.se
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och för nya kollegor att haka på vår resa!** 




  





 I den här rekryteringen har vi följande steg;
 


* Verksamhetsintervju
* Personlighet- och logisk test med personlighetsintervju
* Slutintervju
* Referenser
* Bakgrundskontroll

title: Usability Engineer Getinge Critcal Care Solna
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Are you passionate about improving the user experience of medical devices? Are you driven by a desire to make a positive impact on healthcare professionals daily work and patients lives? If so, Getinge is looking for a talented Interaction designer/Usability Engineer to join our dynamic team!
   

  

 We are now in the beginning of a new project to develop a huge upgrade of our Anesthesia devices, used in operations rooms all over the world. You will play an important role throughout the product development cycle, from concept to final product.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Getinge is well known for providing a safe and pleasurable user experience in all their medical devices. As an Interaction designer/Usability Engineer at Getinge, you will play a crucial role in nourishing and developing that legacy. You will work in a cross-functional team, including design, engineering, clinical experts, product owners and regulatory affairs, to ensure that our product meet the highest standards of usability, safety, and effectiveness.
   

  

 The role is also strategic, which means that you will internally drive and communicate our vision for the user experience. This role is perfect for you who have ideas and visions and long for the right conditions to implement them.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Conduct user research, including interviews, observations, and usability testing, to identify user needs.
* Design the user experience with our common Getinge design system (GUIDE) as a solid foundation.
* Collaborate with the product development team to define user interface requirements and design specifications.
* Execute usability testing, analyze data, and provide actionable recommendations to improve the user experience.
* Conduct risk assessments related to the use of the device.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in usability engineering and human factors.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Interaction design, Human Factors Engineering or a related field.
* Proficiency in conducting user research and usability testing.
* Strong knowledge of user-centered design principles and methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Experience with wireframing and prototyping tools such as Figma is an advantage.
* Experience of medical device industry is an advantage. As well as familiarity with regulatory standards and guidelines related to medical device usability (e.g. IEC 62366 and FDA Human Factors Engineering Guidance.)


 You are a true team player and excellent in building relations. You are used to work against deadlines and often exceeds expectations. You will have a broad responsibility and high ability to prioritize. We hope you have a curious mindset and willing to develop and improve routines and procedures.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Katarina Dahlén at Katarina.dahlen@getinge.com or recruiter Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired MedTech company.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Business Information Architect with data governance experience
description:
**Job ID:
 ******28594********
 We are looking for a Business Information Architect with experience in information architecture and data governance and who enjoy coaching and inspiring others.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the Group Business Support Data Governance DoE team. Our role is to guide and secure that Nordea Group data policies and frameworks are implemented within the Group Business Support area, as well as drive modelling of business information and standardization of information in the data councils.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity to be part of the continuous development and maturation of information architecture in the Group Business Support Area in Nordea.
   

  

 Our team sit in Group Data Management and is located across the Nordic countries. The 6 team members report to the data officer in Group Business Support and support a variety of stakeholders.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Support the implementation of data policies, principles and standards in daily production and in development activities
* Ensure data governance processes are compliant and implemented according to relevant regulations, internal policies and are cost efficient
* Engage with business units and change initiatives, to ensure efficient and aligned usage of information and data
* Participate and contribute to the information architecture discipline in the Nordea Group


**Who You Are**
 This is the right role for you if you are recognised as a team player, acknowledged for your independent drive, collaboration and business intuition. You have strong analytical and conceptual skills to suggest solutions in a complex environment.
   

  

 You are comfortable in networking with the ability to cooperate with people in all parts of the organisation and on different levels. Working with people is something you enjoy, and you are able understand, motivate, influence and empower others.
   

  

**Your background and skills include:**
* Experience working with data or information from a business perspective
* Experience in data governance or related field within the financial services industry, and ability to translate that experience to assess current and future information and data requirements
* Experience supporting and guiding as a specialist


**It would be ideal if you also:**
* Have experience from similar roles previously and are experienced within the areas such as Risk, Finance, AML etc.
* Have experience in data governance processes, enterprise architecture layers (business, information, IT solutions) or requirements assessment and implementation


**What We Offer**
 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

 A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

 Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 14/02/2025.
   

  

**The recruitment process consists of the following steps:**
* Preliminary CV selection
* Phone conversation with the recruiter
* Online interview with the hiring leader


 We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.
   

  

**We build relationships** 
 . We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change** 
 . We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea** 
 . We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden** 
 : For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.

title: Solution Architect - Customer Area (CRM Solutions/Loyalty)
description:
**Job Description**
**This is an opportunity to join a team of Solution Architects, working on cutting edge retail solutions within our company on several different areas from product creation, through logistics, to sales in store or online.**
 As a Solution Architect for Portfolio Brands, you will work with stakeholders in different Brands in the Group and play a critical role in driving growth, profitability, and scalability across both digital and retail domains. This position requires a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of technology solutions and their application in the fashion retail industry.
   

  

 In this role as Solution Architect, you will be responsible for translating business and tech requirements into architecture blueprints. You will also conduct thorough analysis of existing solutions, identify gaps, and recommend improvements. To deliver in this role you will have to evaluate the architecture holistically, use deep technical expertise to understand the business impact of technical components, and give recommendations and guidelines for teams implementing solutions.
   

  

 You want work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and open to change. You show commitment and ownership and demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy, architectural governance and standards. Effective team player that can express the importance of technical concepts and quality, emerging technologies, ideas, feelings, opinions, and conclusions to peers and people with an only limited technical background and contribute positively to your team environment.
   

  

 We are looking for a Solution Architect for the
 ***Customer***
 area.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define a shared technical and architectural vision focused on creating technical alignment for the full solution rather than concerns for specific components.
* Review, analyze, develop and facilitate stakeholder understanding of business and technology implication of future direction, roadmaps and implementation plans.
* Create architectural design to guide and contextualize solution development across initiatives that aligns with business and IT goals.
* Provide necessary leadership, analysis and design tasks related to the development of technology solutions to ensure that solutions meet business needs and align with architectural governance and standards.
* Identify interdependencies and use ‘holistic thinking’ to ensure the cross-team perspective. Provide consulting support around solution architecture to teams to ensure a product is aligned with the overall enterprise architecture
* Translate business and technical requirements into architectural blueprints and document all solution architecture design and analysis.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement, reducing technical debt, and enhancing end-to-end business value.
* Work continuously with incorporating broader aspects such as overall product costs/revenue, data privacy & sovereignty, business continuity, information security, integration with other systems, etc.
* Facilitate best practice sharing and teach architecture thinking to engineering and product community.
* Take ownership and responsibility of current solutions and flows and ensure secure and stable operations with good focus on resolving recurring problems to the root cause.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT with experience in Solution architecture in the retail or fashion industry.
* Proven track record in designing and implementing scalable solutions in digital and retail environments.
* Experience in working with CRM, CDP, CEM, loyalty platforms etc.
* Experience in working in complex landscape with a combination of cloud solution and Enterprise Applications such as SAP.
* Strong understanding of cloud computing, microservices architecture, APIs, and integration frameworks.
* Ability to understand and visualize concepts that are not yet concrete, and use your problem-solving skills, strong analytic ability, creativity and customer and business drive to find a solution.
* Ability to create both high-level and low-level design documentation and technical specification.
* Experience of planning and driving workshops with implementation teams, architects as well as business stakeholders.
* Ability to work with composability frameworks and support to define Packaged Business Capabilities (PBCs) to ensure scalable and modular architectural solutions.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Knowledge of data analytics, AI, and machine learning applications in retail.
* Advanced degree or certifications in architecture frameworks (e.g., TOGAF) is a plus.


**Benefits**
**Additional Information**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Seinor SAP BW Consultant
description:
Avigna is hiring Seinor SAP BW Consultant
   

  

 Our SAP Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for Seinor SAP BW Consultant to join the team to build, support and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule. If you want to grow and build the foundation on the S4 Hana platform working across multiple customers, look no further.
   

  

 In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
   

  

**Experience:** 
 10+ years
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Mode of work:** 
 Onsite
   

  

**Required Skills**
* Experience in at least three full life cycle implementations on SAP BW or BW/4HANA with HANA Modeling.
* Consultant should have prior experience working on SAP BW projects with European clients
* Hands-on experience with SAP Analytics Cloud and Power BI for frontend analytics
* Extensive experience in SAP BW Retail scenarios which includes General Ledger, Billing (SAP ECC), Inventory Management (SAP ECC),POS-data (SAP CAR),Warehouse transactions (SAP EWM)
* Experience with CDS Views-based data modeling, data integration, and provisioning to/from SAP BW.
* Expertise in Data Volume Management, preferably in projects handling large datasets.
* Proficiency in SAP Datasphere.
* Strong team player in an Agile environment, capable of handling diverse tasks to meet sprint commitments.
* Ability to facilitate Scrum events and actively drive development while coaching and guiding the team in Scrum practices and values.
* Sound Knowledge on Integrated Planning/BPC.


**Nice-to-have**
**Benefits:**
 Competitive Salary
   

  

 Pension, Health, Occupation injury, and sick insurances
   

  

 Opportunity to latest courses and certification
   

  

**Other Company Benefits**
 AVIGNA holds Service authorization for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP Business All in one.
   

  

 We have received an
 **SAP Recognized Expertise designation for SAP® S/4HANA.** 
 We have consultants serving various customers using SAP and non-SAP products. Our Consulting experience spans across Telecom, Retail, Electrical, Paper, and Social Service Industries.

title: Är du vår nästa Analytics Consultant?
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Vi letar nu efter fler kollegor till vår växande grupp datakonsulter; personer som gillar att skapa magi genom data & analys!
   

  

 Våra närmare 100 dataexperter i Sverige jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier, både med och utan cloud. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

 Såhär beskriver vår Analytics konsult Alexandra sitt nuvarande projekt:
   

  

 “Jag hjälper kunden att utveckla en app för att följa upp kostnader i stora projekt, för att se till att man ligger i linje med budgeten och fakturerar enligt plan. Mitt uppdrag hos kunden kommer att breddas framöver då jag nyligen hjälpt till att göra en kartläggning av Power BI-behov i hela verksamheten. Vi har bland annat hittat behov inom kvalitet och hållbarhetsredovisning – vilket jag tycker är extra spännande då det knyter an till mitt intresse för området. Det bästa med uppdraget är samarbetet – jag är del av ett Scrum-team bestående av bolagets egna it-medarbetare och användare. Det är också tryggt att ha Solitas community i ryggen, jag vet att jag aldrig är ensam, det finns alltid hjälp att få av kollegorna”
   

  

**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
* Du diskuterar gärna datavisualiseringar och databaser, och bygger inspirerande dashboards
* Du kan implementera datalösningar som fungerar både för dataexperter och beslutsfattare på företag
* Du lär dig gärna nya teknologier och metoder
* Du har över två års erfarenhet med Tableau, Power BI och SQL
* Du är intresserad och nyfiken av teknologier och data


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på. Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, och vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete, och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

**På Solita Får Du**
* Projekt som skapar riktiga avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället
* Nya teknologier
* En arbetskultur med hög självständighet och tillit
* Variation: i projekt, i teknologier, i angreppsätt
* Personlig utveckling och möjligheten att lära sig både från erfarna experter och våra interna utbildningssatsningar och communities
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med bl.a. 30 semesterdagar, fredagsfrukostar, aw:s, bike leasing, inhouse coach, yoga på kontoret, och möjlighet till extra pensionsavsättningar under din föräldraledighet


 Blev du nyfiken? Hör av dig till oss!
   

  

***Solita är ett företag som jobbar med digital transformation, styrd av data och mänsklig expertis. Vi har kontor i Sverige, Finland, Tyskland, Estland, Belgien, Norge, Danmark och Schweiz.***
***Vid frågor; kontakta sara.lindstrom(at)solita.se eller ansök här. Vi uppskattar dina färdigheter, men vi är också ivriga att lära oss om essensen i din motivation och hur du ser din tillväxt framför dig. Dela ditt CV nedan så återkommer vi så fort vi kan!***

title: Account Manager for Production Planning (Fighter Production)/ Linköping
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As an Account Manager for Production Planning (Fighter Production), you will play a key role in optimizing and securing efficient workflows between forecasting, planning, ordering, production, and delivery. You will act as the central link between ordering Business Units, external partners (including Brazil), and Fighter Production.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage and develop efficient processes between internal customers and production.
* Set planning conditions and ensure a smooth delivery process.
* Monitor KPIs and delivery precision.
* Act as the Point of Contact for order-related inquiries.
* Develop Customer Agreements, balancing capacity and resources against demand.
* Drive process improvements through digitalization and automation.
* Collaborate closely with Production Planning within Fighter Production and work with internal and external stakeholders.


**Requirements**
* Technical or economic degree at university level or equivalent experience.
* Minimum 3 years of experience in planning and/or procurement.
* Strong theoretical knowledge of planning, logistics, and inventory management.
* Experience working with business systems such as IFS/ERP.
* Strong analytical skills with a holistic understanding of planning processes.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English (spoken & written).
* Ability to work independently, drive processes, and solve problems proactively
* Experience in production and/or aircraft manufacturing.
* Experience working with continuous improvement and process digitalization.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swathianantu@vipas.se &contact me at +46760294155
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Lifecycle Marketing Manager (SaaS)
description:
At Stratsys, we offer a smart compliance SaaS platform that simplifies ESG, GRC, and Strategic work processes. We’re now looking for a Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our marketing team of eight in Stockholm. 
   

  

 In this role, you’ll play a key part in guiding our customers through their journey with us. Using tools like HubSpot, you’ll create smart e-mail marketing initiatives and automated workflows that deliver the right message at the right time.
 



 This is a role for someone who loves combining data and creativity to drive results. You’ll analyze customer behavior, test new strategies, and continuously improve how we engage with our customers and prospects. All while being part of a collaborative, fun, and ambitious team that wins together.
   





**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
 **💡****



* An engaging work environment with people who share a mindset to deliver a world-class product in important and impactful areas.
* Opportunities to learn about GRC, ESG, Strategic work processes and work with both the public and private sectors.
* Challenging, varied, and rewarding tasks with room to be independent and innovative.
* A high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Take a look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture!
* Work from a fantastic and central office in one of Hötorgsskraporna in Stockholm.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about them here!


****ABOUT THE ROLE  📌****

  

 As our Lifecycle Marketing Manager, you’ll be at the heart of our customer journey strategy—designing and optimizing nurturing flows, campaigns, and communication that drive engagement and growth.
 



 Your focus will be to:
 


* Attract and convert leads into high-intent MQLs to fuel our sales pipeline.
* Engage and grow our customer base with targeted, relevant communication.
* Find ways through email marketing and automation to both retain our customers as well as grow with them through upsell and cross-sell.
* Ensure sign ups, attendance, and follow up on webinars and events.



 Your primary tool will be HubSpot, where you’ll automate workflows, track performance, and continuously test new approaches—including AI-driven strategies—to refine and improve our communication.
 



 This is a highly collaborative role, working closely with marketing, sales, and our Data/AI team to optimize customer engagement and drive growth. A perfect mix of data and creativity, where you’ll have the space to experiment, optimize, and make a real impact.
 


**YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️**


* 3 years of experience in B2B marketing automation or lifecycle marketing, ideally within SaaS.
* HubSpot is your go-to tool — you know how to get the most out of it but are always curious about new features and better ways of working.
* You understand customer needs and can spot patterns that drive engagement.
* Expertise of lead nurturing, lead scoring, and CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization).
* An educational background in Marketing, Marketing Automation, or a related field (Higher Vocational Education, Bachelor's, or Master's level).
* You’re fluent in Swedish and based in Stockholm.



**It’s a bonus if you have:** 



* Experience with tools like DreamData or similar attribution and insights tools.
* Experience with GA4.


**ABOUT YOU 👀** 

 You’re someone who loves the mix of data, systems, and communication. You enjoy digging into customer insights, finding patterns, and figuring out how to reach the right audience at the right time. You thrive in a role where you can test new ideas, optimize workflows, and see the results of your work.
 



 Collaboration is key in this role, and you’re someone who naturally connects with others. Whether it’s brainstorming with marketing colleagues, working closely with sales, or asking for input from other teams, you know how to build relationships and get things done.
 



 You’re also someone who finds satisfaction in the details – from analyzing campaign performance to tweaking email flows until they’re just right. If you love seeing systems work smarter and enjoy the challenge of making complex processes simple, this role is for you. 
 


 ABOUT US 🚀
 
 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with selection of candidates.
 



 Is this particular role not quite right for you -  Show your interest by connecting with us, we are constantly looking for new talent for our growing business in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Oslo. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook.

title: Systemoperatör till Riksbankens betalningssystem på deltid
description:
****Vill du vara med och a** 
**rbeta på en spännande arbetsplats där Sveriges betalningssystem står i fokus? Systemet omsätter dagligen ca 550 miljarder svenska kronor och det är av största vikt att systemet drivs på ett säkert och effektivt sätt. Vi söker nu en serviceinriktad person till vårt team med intresse för finansiella sektorn och** 
**IT-system.****
**VI ERBJUDER DIG**
 Hos RIX-enheten på Riksbanken får du möjlighet att delta i en spännande förändringsresa inom den svenska finansiella infrastrukturen. Du kommer att vara med och delta i att driva, förvalta och utveckla Riksbankens betalningssystem. Som systemoperatör är du med i teamet som säkerställer att RIX-systemet fungerar smidigt och att våra deltagare, banker och finansiella institut, erhåller en förstklassig service. Rollen innebär att du hanterar systemadministrativa arbetsuppgifter, säkerställer korrekt utförande av arbetsuppgifter samt sköter eventuella händelser i systemen som kräver omedelbar hantering.
   

  

 Tjänsten är på deltid, ca 20 % av en heltidstjänst. Passen är på bankdagar mellan 06:30–10:30 omväxlande 14:30-18:30 enligt ett rullande schema. Under sommarmånaderna, mellandagar samt vissa andra perioder förväntas du kunna arbeta på heltid vid behov. Tjänsten ger dig även möjligheten till en värdefull insikt i Riksbankens arbete och roll i den komplexa finansiella infrastrukturen.
   

  

**MER OM DIG**
 Vi söker dig som studerar på universitet på en, för tjänsten, passande utbildning. Det är meriterande om du studerar ekonomi eller systemvetenskap, samt att du har minst 2 år kvar av dina studier. För tjänsten krävs också att du har erfarenhet av och lätt för att arbeta i olika system samt att du har en god analysförmåga, är intiativtagande och har en problemlösande attityd. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av arbete med systemadministration, kundservice, incidenthantering, back-office och operativ clearing.
   

  

 Din noggrannhet, goda kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga, analytiska förmåga och serviceinriktning samt lugna förhållningssätt är avgörande för framgång i rollen. Du behöver också ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift, eftersom du kommer att ha både svenska och internationella kontakter.
   

  

**DITT TEAM**
 Riksbanken består av nio avdelningar. Enheten för RIX tillhör avdelningen för betalningar. RIX-enheten består av ca 35 medarbetare och är indelat i två team. Du kommer att tillhöra teamet RIX vidareutveckling och förvaltning som består av 15 medarbetare och som leds av en gruppchef. Hos oss får du kunniga och engagerade kollegor och stor möjlighet till kompetensutveckling inom finansiell infrastruktur. Här kan du läsa mer om Riksbankens organisation.
   

  

**MER OM TJÄNSTEN**
 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Anställningstyp: Tillsvidareanställning (deltid, vid behov, med timpenning) som inleds med provanställning, 6 månader
   

  

 Placering: Huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Fast arbetstid enligt rullande schema
   

  

 Möjlighet att jobba på distans: Nej
   

  

 Förmåner: subventionerad lunch, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**ATT JOBBA PÅ RIKSBANKEN**
 Riksbanken är en myndighet under riksdagen som ser till att pengarna behåller sitt värde över tid och att betalningar kan ske säkert och effektivt. Vi ger också ut Sveriges sedlar och mynt. Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på Riksbanken här .
   

  

**ANSÖKAN**
 Vi vill ha din ansökan med CV, personligt brev och relevanta betyg senast den 10 februari 2025. Vi vill även att du i denna rekrytering besvarar ett antal urvalsfrågor. Logiska tester kan också ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Vi genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att vi verifierar de utbildningsdokument som krävs för anställningen. Intervjuer sker löpande. Du kan läsa mer om hur det fungerar när du söker jobb på Riksbanken här . Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!
   

  

 Vi återkopplar till dig via mail och ber dig att noga se över både inkorg och skräppost så du inte missar något. Du får också gärna kontakta oss med vändande mail om du upptäcker att utskicken inte hamnar rätt.

title: Head of Operations Nordics
Vice President for Government (Public Sector), Acceptance & Partners-R-240240
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Vice President for Government (Public Sector), Acceptance & Partners
   

  

**About The Role**
 Mastercard is looking for a strategic, dynamic, and results-oriented leader to serve as Vice President for Government (Public Sector), Acceptance & Partners. This is a high-impact role, shaping the acceptance network, fostering meaningful partnerships, and driving innovative solutions across Northern Europe. The role spans nine markets (Nordics, Baltics, and the Netherlands) and reports directly to the President of Northern Europe, with a dotted line to the Public Sector Lead for Europe.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

 Strategic Leadership
   

  

* Develop and implement strategies to expand Mastercard’s acceptance network, enhance partnerships and drive the Governmental business (not Public Policy, that is handled by a separate team who you will work closely together with) within Northern Europe.
* Align business development efforts with divisional and global priorities to maximize revenue growth and market penetration.
* Serve as a strategic advisor to the leadership team on acceptance, partner, and government-related business initiatives.


 Business Development overall
   

  

* Drive acceptance growth by identifying and pursuing opportunities to increase Mastercard’s presence in existing and new areas where payments are or should be accepted.
* Drive the sales to the Government sector by leveraging current Mastercard offerings and to define the future need of this segment enabled by new products or partnerships
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support new business models and innovative acceptance solutions.
* Lead financial modeling and business case development for acceptance, partnership and Government opportunities.


 Government Engagement (Public Sector) deep dive
   

  

 The Public Sector role focuses on aligning Mastercard’s products, services and ecosystem capabilities to solve for the challenges Government clients face today in the areas of financial inclusion, citizen services, economic development and government operational excellence.
   

  

* Develop and execute the Division Public Sector strategy starting from understanding local, regional and global priorities, engaging Division leadership to prioritize clients and solution opportunities relevant for the Division, developing a solid projects pipeline and driving conversion over time to secure new revenues.
* Identify and pursue the prioritized business development opportunities leveraging Mastercard assets through collaboration with Governmental entities and external private partners who can act as channel partners.
* Secure global, regional and local resources to execute on the opportunities and drive marquee wins.
* Develop and execute strategies to enhance Mastercard’s presence in government-led initiatives, fostering acceptance and innovation.
* Partner with government bodies to promote policies and frameworks that enable greater adoption of Mastercard solutions.


 Partnership and Stakeholder Engagement
   

  

* Cultivate and strengthen relationships with key stakeholders, including government bodies, regulators, and industry associations.
* Lead negotiations and discussions with partners to secure agreements that align with Mastercard’s strategic goals and that complement Mastercard to become even more locally relevant.
* Represent Mastercard in external forums to advocate for policies and initiatives that support business growth and innovation.


 Operational Excellence
   

  

* Oversee pipeline management and ensure the efficient execution of business development activities.
* Evaluate and enhance the deal process to deliver improved outcomes and streamlined execution.
* Track and report on the progress of acceptance, partnership, and government initiatives, using data to inform strategic decisions.


 Team Leadership
   

  

* Lead and inspire a team of specialists focused on acceptance, partners, and government activities.
* Provide mentorship and direction to ensure alignment with Mastercard’s vision and priorities.
* Foster a collaborative and high-performance culture within the team.
* Work in close partnership with other functions and country leads to align with Mastercard overall agenda and to maximize total value for Mastercard and its customers


 What You Bring
   

  

* Strategic Expertise: Proven experience in developing and executing business development strategies within complex, multi-country environments.
* Market Development: Deep understanding of payment acceptance, financial services, and partnership ecosystems.
* Government Relations: Extensive experience engaging with governments, regulators, and industry bodies to influence policies and create business opportunities.
* Leadership: Strong ability to lead cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Commercial Acumen: Demonstrated success in driving revenue growth through innovative partnerships and acceptance solutions.
* Project Management: Exceptional organizational and execution skills to manage multiple priorities effectively.


 Why Mastercard?
   

  

 At Mastercard, we’re building a world where everyone has the opportunity to thrive, using our technology and expertise to advance inclusive, secure, and seamless payment ecosystems. By joining our team, you’ll contribute to a company that prioritizes sustainability, innovation, and global impact.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 If you are passionate about driving growth, innovation, and collaboration in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and help shape the future of payments in Northern Europe!
   

  

**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


 R-240240

title: Regional HR Manager - EMEA
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Regional
 **HR Manager** 
 at Canonical to support our EMEA region.
   

  

 With 1,100+ colleagues across 75 countries, we require an HR function that thinks and acts globally. We're looking for a regional lead that will report into our Global Head of HR who can help build our company as we go through continued growth plans. It's an exciting time to join with the opportunity to help shape and create an HR function for the future. You will lead the EMEA team of HR professionals to provide precise, compliant and scalable HR operations to the business, advise and execute on HR issues across the whole employee life-cycle, and partner with senior leadership in your region. You will have an analytical approach, a keen eye for detail and the ability to interpret data trends and themes.
   

  

 The role entails the individual to:
   

  

* Lead and scale Canonical's regional HR team (1-4 direct reports, depending on region)
* Deliver precise and compliant HR operations in a timely manner and with the highest degree of accuracy
* Interact closely with Talent Science and Workplace Engineering teams and create tight-knit processes across all HR regions
* Be accountable for HR processes such as talent development, succession planning, performance assessments, onboarding, culture and engagement initiatives that drive high performing teams
* Work with senior managers across the business on performance management, organizational design, employee engagement, rewards- and workforce planning
* Coach and advise people managers on the full spectrum of employee relations issues across multiple countries
* Partner with people managers to support the delivery of appropriate training and development programs
* Establish a trusted partnership with the business in your region
* Drive diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives
* Design new policies and deliver on business-critical HR related projects globally
* Present at Canonical events to articulate Canonical's HR practices


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* HR experience leading initiatives across regions within a technology business
* People management experience
* Experience in business partnering with senior stakeholders
* A good balance between leading and executing, in this role you will need to be hands-on involved in the daily HR routines, too
* Experience in working in a remote first organization
* Able to leverage data to make informed decisions
* Knowledge and practical implementation of HR practices and employment law across EMEA
* Fluent in business English (written and spoken)
* Self motivated, organized, accurate, confident, authentic, results-orientated, open-minded, enthusiastic and energetic
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* Experience with immigration policies and mobility processes
* Professional HR qualification (CIPD/SHRM or other)
* Facilitation skills


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Global Loyalty & CRM Manager to H&M
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As our Global Loyalty & CRM Manager at H&M, you will lead a dynamic team of Loyalty Business Experts, Email and Push Analysts, and a micro CRM team. This role is pivotal in driving customer loyalty and engagement through strategic CRM initiatives. You will be responsible for setting a clear loyalty strategy, ensuring data-driven decision-making, and fostering a unified view of a profitable customer.
   

  

* Develop and implement a global loyalty strategy with clear milestones for different relationship phases. Define ROI KPIs for both paid and owned channels, and set customer goals, including new customer acquisition and lifecycle management.
* Lead a team of 16, including Loyalty Business Experts, Email and Push Analysts, and a CRM team. Ensure clear roles, responsibilities, and quarterly goals for team members, and foster personal and professional growth within the team.
* Utilize customer data to drive educated decision-making and understand trends. Develop a clear customer data strategy supporting segmentation and product categories, and collaborate with the Future Commerce team to ensure a robust tech foundation.
* Work with the full Marketing Department to ensure strong and inspirational communication. Collaborate with Sales to develop clear onboarding and trigger strategies, and ensure regional execution excellence with clear cost control and alignment with brand identity.
* Set the technical roadmap in collaboration with the value stream to ensure future-proof solutions. Maintain cost control over the loyalty program.
* Create clear consumer journeys to maximize organic traffic and sales. Ensure data is used to fuel the relevance program and support profitability goals.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with:
   

  

* Proven experience in running a global loyalty program and CRM department.
* Strong digital and technical savvy.
* Extensive marketing experience.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills.
* Strong analytical and data-driven decision-making abilities.
* Ability to develop and execute strategic plans.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Personal Attributes**
* Visionary leader with the ability to inspire and motivate a team.
* Strategic thinker with a focus on customer-centric solutions.
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
* Adaptable and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application. The last day to submitt your CV is 14th of february.*

title: Procurement Expert
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way.  Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are currently in search of a
 **Procurement Expert** 
 to support Warehouse 3PL area to ensure the best possible procurement deals by executing centrally led procurement activities from initiation to bid evaluation, supplier selection and contract finalization in close collaboration with key stakeholders.
   

  

*Within H&M our Logistics network ensures a seamless, flexible, and swift distribution process, by delivering products for our stores and online customers, every single day.*
 Working as part of our demand-driven, efficient, circular Supply Chain, our dynamic Logistics teams are consciously committed to and guided by our values. We work with innovative technical solutions, with our customer in mind. We do not just go with the flow - we manage it, together with our service-focused, competent, motivated teams around the world.
   

  

*The main responsibilities within the role are:*
* Execute centrally led procurement activities for Warehouse categories (e.g. 3PL, Lease) from initiation to bid evaluation, supplier selection and contract finalization in close collaboration with key stakeholders.
* Collaborate with Category Managers and regional commercial teams to identify and implement the most optimal procurement, negotiation and commercial strategy per category.
* Ensure that key stakeholders are involved in the procurement process to define goals & strategy, business needs, risks, also assessing suppliers, evaluating offers and enabling decision making.
* Ensure that market analysis, benchmarking and due diligence are part of the procurement process and secure follow-up on the outcome of procurement process over time.
* Ensure compliance with procurement policies, ethical standards and regulatory requirements.
* Define needs and utilize procurement systems and tools to streamline processes, maintaining accurate records and improving benchmarking and transparency.
* Act as logistics center of excellence for procurement, continuously developing toolsets, templates and trainings to strengthen knowledge level and skills within the organization.
* Support regions and global logistics teams in negotiations upon request or according to agreed thresholds.
* Actively stay up-to-date on global logistics end-to-end operational status, KPIs, issues and risks.
* Identify sustainability opportunities and challenges from a social, economic and environmental perspective.


**Qualifications**
*We are looking for you, who have:*
* University degree in Business Administration, Industrial Engineering & Management, Legal or Tech.
* Strategic mindset and deep expertise and proven experience in procurement, Contract and Vendor Management for Logistics related 3PL services and processes.
* Deep expertise and proven experience in negotiation for Logistics related services and processes, also providing good understanding of global standards and local legislations.
* Strong analytical capabilities, including the ability to conduct spend analysis and opportunity assessment.
* Understanding of different pricing models and contract structures.
* Good ability to collaborate, interact and navigate with central, regional and local teams and stakeholders, both internally and externally, with all levels of seniority.
* Strong understanding of logistics supplier requirements as well as compliance-, sustainability- and performance criteria’s.
* Strong analytical and financial knowledge, consistently focusing on driving customer value and improving profitability to generate business value.
* The role involves frequent communication with international suppliers and colleagues, requiring strong English language skills.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position at our Head Office in Stockholm or in Borås, starting as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your resume in English (no need for cover letter) latest 13th of February. The assessment process will start immediately so please apply as soon as possible!
   

  

  

  

 At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Why kindly ask you to not attach cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

  

  

 Our teams at H&M Group should consist of great mix of people with different perspectives that share and combine their knowledge, experiences, and ideas. It leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, what we perceive possible and how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world.
   

  

  

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Head of Stakeholder Management
description:
Seize the opportunity to join a rapidly growing business and take on a position with great responsibility and possibility to influence further growth – both ours and yours.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Head of Stakeholder Management to join our business. This is a strategically important role where you will be a key person in our work to strengthen Fortum's position in the Swedish wind power market in the coming years. Do you want to help shape the future of energy? Then this is the position for you!
   

  

 The location of the position depends on your preference and can be in any region of Sweden. We have offices for example in Stockholm, Östersund, Karlstad, Gothenburg and Malmö.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Head of Stakeholder Management you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Fortum's strong relationships with stakeholders in our wind and solar power development projects.
   

  

 The role will promote local engagement for our business, which is crucial for the success of our projects. The role involves ensuring that stakeholder needs and expectations are effectively managed and that their engagement with the project or business is positive and productive. The role involves working with stakeholder management during the project development phase of the project, i.e. from start to construction.
   

  

 In the role as Head of Stakeholder Management, the following will be part of your responsibilities:
   

  

  

* Lead and develop the Stakeholder Management team in Sweden.
* Developing strategies: Creating and implementing strategies to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders in each project.
* Communication: Ensuring clear and regular communication with stakeholders through various channels.
* Support to Project Managers and Regional Managers: A coaching role in managing local media contacts, as well as responsibility for local press contacts and project-related news, in collaboration with Fortum’s newsdesk/press manager.
* Engagement: Organizing and leading meetings, workshops, and other engagement activities to gather feedback and build relationships.
* Analysis: Conduct stakeholder analyses to identify and understand stakeholder needs, expectations, and impacts.
* Reporting: Document and report on stakeholder engagement and feedback to the project team.
* Risk management: Identify and manage risks related to stakeholder engagement and impact on the project.
* Branding: Develop and implement strategies to maintain and reinforce Fortum's brand with stakeholders. This includes ensuring that Fortum's values and brand promises are communicated clearly and consistently.
* Collaboration internally: Be the first point of contact with Fortum’s Corporate Relations Businesses (CRB) team to ensure that all efforts are aligned with Fortum's overall communication plans, the wind and solar communication plan, brand strategy, and visual identity.


 The Fortum organization has key experts in each area of Wind and Solar (engineering, construction, operation), as well as more business-related experts (procurement, offtake, and strategy) to support you in your work. The final scope of your role in the team will be adapted based on your expertise, experience, but also your interests.
   

  

 This role requires the ability to travel several days a month in the course of your duties. You will be reporting to the Head of Development Sweden.
   

  

**About You**
 The following competences will help you to success in the role as Head of Stakeholder Management:
   

  

  

* Education: Bachelor's degree in communication, marketing, business administration or similar.
* Experience: Several years in stakeholder management or related fields. Several years of experience in stakeholder management in wind power and solar projects.
* Competences: Strong communication and relationship building skills, project management skills, analytical and problem solving skills.
* Languages: Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


 Personal characteristics:
   

  

  

* Communicative: Easy to communicate with multiple stakeholder groups
* Empathetic: Ability to understand and relate to stakeholder perspectives and needs.
* Proactive: Ability to take initiative and drive engagement activities forward.
* Flexible: Adaptable and able to manage change and different stakeholder needs.


**We offer you**
 Fortum Wind & Solar is embarking on an exciting growth journey. The greatest challenge of our time awaits you. To drive the change for a cleaner world, we need to reshape the energy system and we want you to be part of it. To reach our goals, we embrace a culture of openness, with mutual trust, believing in people, and taking care of everyone's wellbeing, we can reach even better results. Flexibility is the new normal and we apply a hybrid way of working wherever possible.
   

  

 You will have first row seats to the renewables market and its dynamics through the vantage point of one of the largest energy companies in the Nordics. You will be a part of a tightly linked team and unit, that values a safe and friendly working environment, where wellbeing is emphasized. You will have the possibility to challenge yourself, to develop and learn new skills and expertise by collaborating with top experts while also bringing your own experience to the table, and to form personal connections with wonderful people.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application latest on 27th of February. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Karl-Johan Hellblom at karl-johan.hellblom@fortum.com or Recruitment Partner Lisa Kylberg at lisa.kylberg@partners.fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page.**
**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Real Estate Maintenance Manager
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker nu en erfaren Real Estate Maintenance Manager till våra fastigheter i Norden!
   

  

 Real Estate enheten är 9 personer inom Real Estate & Facility Management Nordic (RE&FM Nordic) som ansvarar för lokalförsörjning och hanterar 11 000 arbetsplatser, strategier samt underhåll av i första hand kommersiella fastigheter i Sverige men även andra delar av Norden. Vi växer och nu har du möjligheten att vara med och delta i arbetet mot fossilfrihet.
   

  

 Som Real Estate Maintenance Manager ansvarar du i första hand för underhåll, besiktnings- och förvaltningsplaner, vilket även ska dokumenteras och uppdateras noggrant i våra system för budgetbeslut, inköp och utförande.
   

  

 Med stöd av förvaltningsplaner för fastigheterna du kommer behöva skapa både kortsiktiga och långsiktiga underhållsplaner som styr beslut om investeringar och reparationer. Befattningen som Real Estate Maintenance Manager är strategiskt viktig för vårt fastighetsportfölj och ställer stora krav på ett hållbart och långsiktigt fastighetsnyttjande.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter som Real Estate Maintenance Manager är:**
* Tydliggör underhållsprocessen i samordning med REFM, BU och vår affärsplan.
* Strategiskt styr det planerade underhållsarbetet med hjälp av systemstöd och processer för att säkerställa att fastigheternas skick dokumenteras på ett strukturerat sätt.
* Utför platsbesök och stickprov för att säkerställa att besiktnings- och underhållsplaner är i ordning, vilket även gäller vid köp av nya fastigheter.
* Paketera nya projekt för fastighetsportföljen för att effektivisera upphandlingen.
* Löpande analysera kompetens- och resursbehov.
* Kontaktperson och arbetsledning av konsulter och entreprenörer.
* Ansvara för förvaltningsplaner, besiktningar och hållbarhetsfrågor.
* Säkerställa lag och myndighetskrav.


 Din bakgrund
   

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område och/eller förvärvat motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Flera års erfarenhet av fastighetsförvaltning
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av IT, projektekonomi eller portfölj/program management
* Uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska
* Mycket god dator- och systemvana. Du är skicklig med Office paketet, och gärna har erfarenhet av CAD, SAP och Planon
* B-körkort


 Vi ser gärna att du är en erfaren ledare som brinner för att utveckla verksamheten genom att skapa struktur och utveckla både projekt och nya arbetssätt. Du tänker helhet och trivs med att jobba i en roll där du får möjlighet att analysera komplexa frågor och arbeta självständigt. Vi tror att du kommer trivas i rollen om du tycker om att planera, prioritera och följa upp arbetsuppgifter, men kan samtidigt snabbt anpassa dig till nya och utmanande situationer. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och är en effektiv kommunikatör, med din lyhördhet och goda självinsikt har du lätt för att skapa och bibehålla goda relationer med både interna och externa parter, och därtill även hantera många kontakter.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

 För ytterligare information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Head of Real-Estate, Anders Häggström 070-5951375. För information om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Catalina Roa Rodriguez, 070-00 26 802.
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Umeå, Uppsala, Solna eller Göteborg (annan placeringsort där Vattenfall har ett kontor kan eventuellt diskuteras).
   

  

**Känns detta som ett jobb för dig?** 
 Välkommen med din ansökan
 **senast 23 februari 2025** 
 ! Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail, endast via vår webbplats. Urval och intervjuer sker efter sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter:** 
 Rolf Ohlsson (Akademikerna), Inger Strandberg (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna), Juha Siipilehto (SEKO). Du når dem via Vattenfalls växel: 08 739 50 00.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsnedsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

*Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.* 
*I säkerhetsprövningen ingår drogtest.*
*Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!*
 Om oss
   

  

*RE&FM Nordic är en intern leverantör av RE&FM-tjänster i Vattenfall. Vårt uppdrag är att leverera kostnadseffektiva och värdeskapande tjänster utifrån Business Units och stabers gemensamma behov. Vi har medarbetare i Sverige, Finland, Danmark.*
 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem.

title: Arbeta med informationshantering som Säkerhetsadministratör
description:
**RK Informationsförvaltning, Informationsförmedlingen** 
 Är du både säkerhetsmedveten och serviceinriktad och vill arbeta med informationsförmedling i händelsernas centrum? Då kan det här vara en roll för dig.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.** 
 Som säkerhetsadministratör på Förvaltningsavdelningens Informationsförmedling arbetar du med intern och extern distribution av information. Arbetet innebär att du vidareförmedlar inkomna handlingar och information till departementen samt importerar och exporterar data i ett flertal IT-system. Du distribuerar all in- och utgående trafik i Informationsförmedlingens system samt signalskyddssystem. Arbetet sker i enlighet med fastställda rutiner. Andra administrativa arbetsuppgifter som tex diarieföring ingår också. I rollen som säkerhetsadministratör ingår schemalagd beredskapstid på kvällar och helger.
   

  

 Informationsförmedlingen ingår i Regeringskansliets enhet för informationsförvaltning, där du arbetar tillsammans i en grupp på 12 personer. Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se.
   

  

**Din bakgrund** 
 Du har minst gymnasiekompetens men får gärna ha relevant högskoleutbildning. Meriterande är om du har goda kunskaper om säkerhetsskyddslagstiftningen och kan tillämpa den. Du ska även ha god datorvana och god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska. Erfarenhet från arbete med förmedling av skyddsvärd information samt hantering av signalskyddstjänst inom offentlig sektor är meriterande. Vi ser gärna att du genomfört signalskyddsutbildning och har erfarenhet av diarieföring.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper** 
 Som säkerhetsadministratör behöver du vara säkerhetsmedveten, noggrann och ha god förmåga att behålla lugnet i pressade situationer. Andra krav för rollen är att du är självgående, har god samarbetsförmåga och är serviceinriktad.
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Tjänsten är en till tillsvidareanställningar. Anställningen inleds med en 6 månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast enligt överenskommelse.
