title: Tribology Simulation Engineer for Electrified and Conventional Powertrains
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.  

**Scania Offers**  

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.  

  

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.  

**Role Summary**  

We are looking for a tribology simulation engineer for electrified and conventional powertrain applications. You will be involved in presenting the needs for tribological simulations and testing. You will collaborate closely with other tribology engineers, design engineers, test and simulation engineers.  

  

You will perform your own models, simulations, assessments and optimizations, both on your own and in focus group and project constellations.  

  

Your contribution will be much needed in both future technological solutions and in our current project deliveries, all from an end customer approach.  

**This Is Us**  

We are a team with lots of different responsibilities, cultures and diversity. We have the design responsibility for driveline gears, product property target for acoustics, dynamics and load data calculations. We are also specialists in tribology, involved in international projects that push the boundaries of research and innovation. We work both from our team, and within the flow agile landscape (VCT), in a local and global context with colleagues within the Scania and TRATON organization.  

  

To maintain an efficient cooperation and innovation work, we are physically at the Scania office at least three days per week. This means that you have to live close to the Södertälje site.  

**Who You Are**  

You are structured, practical, takes initiatives and have good coordinating abilities. You are a team player and will work in close cooperation with our neighbouring design teams, purchasing department, manufacturing and production units. Besides a foundation within mechanical engineering and tribology, it would be a plus if you also have experience in programming and simulation software tools.  

* You perform your own calculations and multi-body simulations with the help of different tools and software solutions
* You are eager to learn the complex relation between lubrications, friction, wear and its interaction with electrical currents in electrified drivetrains.
* It is considered a bonus if you have previous experience within statistics, programming or FEM/load analytic measurements.

  


**Application**  

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-02-14. Screening and interviews will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.  

  

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:  

Joakim Lindholm, Group Manager, Joakim.lindholm@scania.com or Dr. Jonny Hansen, Senior Engineer, jonny.hansen@scania.com  

  

We look forward for your application!  

**Requisition ID:** 13717

**Part-time / Full-time:** Full-time
**Permanent / Temporary:** Permanent
**Country/Region:** SE
**Location(s):**Södertälje, SE, 151 38
**Required Travel:** 0-25%
**Workplace:** Hybrid

title: Senior Automation Test Engineer C++
description:
##### **Project description**

Luxoft is a leading global software services company, delivering professional services across multiple business verticals such as finance, automotive, and digital transformation.  

  

The Automotive practice inside DXC Luxoft delivers SW projects to a majority of the world's car manufacturers and suppliers for both personal and commercial vehicles. We are known for our Automotive SW expertise and for helping our customers with high quality services and deliveries.  

Currently we are growing for our Swedish customers and are looking for Software Developers to join our team. You will be part of our growing organization in Sweden and will be part of developing next gen systems for the Automotive industry for the age of connected, autonomous, electric vehicles.  

  

Participate in the process of test system flow by defining test activities, equipment, asset under test and DUT (Device Under Test) preparedness together with requirement owner and suppliers.


##### **Responsibilities**


As a senior Test Automation Engineer at Luxoft you will be responsible for:


The ECU component verification, i.e. black and white box test, acceptance test and regression test on deliverables from supplier (both inhouse and external).


Automation of test cases in vTestStudio for Component-/Domain


and Complete testing in bench rig, HIL and on Vehicle. Test Cases to automate are from all functional areas.


Creating and maintain automation test framework in Python and C++ (EMON).


Testing methods & test case development, planning and coordination of test activities together with rest of the team.


Creating Fault reports and assign to receivers to investigate and create solutions.


Reviewing and communicating with suppliers' the test reports and results.


Independently take logs and measurement on the component and actuators and signals.


In collaboration with developer analyze logs to identify root cause of faults.


Ensuring the work is delivered as per specified acceptance criteria and definition.


Reading and analyzing from HIL's or other test set-ups.


Empowering close collaboration with team members within team and other teams.


Being self-organized and outspoken to support the team creating the best solutions.


##### **Skills**


Must have


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering or equivalent education.


At least 8 years of experience from manual and automated verification of automotive embedded software.


Programming knowledge in Python and experience in C++.


Knowledge and understanding how to read electrical schematics, use of instruments such as voltmeters and oscilloscopes.


Experiences of the following tools is preferred: Requirement management tool, Vektor tools like Canalyzer/Canoe (both Hardware and software), Inca and DSA.


Fluent in English.


Swedish B-driver license.


Nice to have


HIL sanity test automation in CANoe (CAPL) or Robot Framework.


Vector tools knowledge.


DSPACE tools knowledge.


JavaScript expert competence.


Docker.


Ansible.


Git, Gerrit, Artifactory.


CI/CD mindset.


Passion for new technologies, software and hardware test and creating great user experiences.


Willing to take up the task that is most important for the team to progress.


##### **Other**


Languages


English: C1 Advanced


Seniority


Senior


  
Goeteborg, Sweden

title: Scrum Master
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



 We are building a high-performance computer-in-the-car architecture with software frameworks to enable easy and seamless services and application development for the Volvo Cars embedded platform. A key success factor for enabling innovation and wonderful user experience on the current and future car models such as EX90, ES90 and EX60. We are leaders in the paradigm shift that is happening in the car industry. Our mission is to create a vehicle computer platform using new technologies like NVIDIA DRIVE™ OS and NVIDIA’s latest chip technology in combination with the BlackBerry™ QNX operating system and more traditional car signaling technologies. We are dedicated to delivering platform functions simplifying the application development to create a safe, reliable, and secure platform solution within Volvo Cars for increased innovation and speed. The location is Lund, Sweden.


**Who you are**
---------------



You want to take part in the transition of the automotive industry, with a leading company in the industry, to be more software centric which brings a better user experience across a wide variety of car functionality from the driver experience, active safety features all the way to the self-driving cars. You have been in the software industry for a while and know what it takes to develop software in a complex multilayered tech stack and platform. While having a big interested in technology, you prefer working with people for people to enable agile software development and relentless learning to build new functionality with fast integrated learning cycles. You can move freely between technical discussion and efficient administration and facilitation of teams in a big organization that collaborates across multiple sites. You are a customer-oriented person who enjoys being part of a group of teams where you take own initiatives and take pride in your own and the team’s deliveries. At the core is a humble attitude with a passion for advanced software development, continuous learning, and team collaboration.


**What you'll do**
------------------



As a Scrum master in our group, you will facilitate two different software development teams in their daily work. You will utilize different agile methods, such as Scrum and Kanban in a large agile framework setup, to help the teams in their efficient software development journey. You will host and perform daily standups, backlog refinements, retrospectives and sprint reviews. You will work closely with the engineering manager, product owner and release train engineer to ensure that the teams have the right information and means to develop requested and proposed features together and across departments at different levels in the software stack. We write software enabling our solutions to be compliant with the highest safety grades in the car industry, which requires high standards on processes and quality assurance activities that you embrace and support. The teams you are joining are, with two other teams, responsible for the service and application framework in our high-performance node in the core computer. Together, we provide frameworks which support our large community of internal application developers in their creative work to shape and evolve fantastic customer functions utilizing the full potential of our software and electronics platform.


In this position you will:


* Facilitate teams of software engineers in a software platform tech stack with the help of stateof-the-art agile methods and practices


* Perform agile ceremonies with the teams such as daily standups, backlog refinements, retrospectives and sprint reviews
* Assist the teams in meeting their delivery goals and information sharing with our stakeholders
* Be close and stay up to date with the technology, from many different aspects, that constitutes a complete car with advanced software and electronics in a multilayered configurable tech stack
* Perform feature and story refinement including architectural designs together with the software engineers and product owner
* Discover and visualize team, tool and process impediments to support continuous improvement
* Work in a highly empowered agile team that is responsible for creating everything from requirements and software architecture to deployments and automated tests


**What you'll bring**
---------------------



The following skills are needed:


• Proficiency in agile methods and practices with multiple years of hands-on experience • Several years of experience as a software developer writing, submitting and maintaining code


* A technical background with a great understanding of the code management life cycle

• The ability to work with people for people, to bring out the best of individuals and teams • Has an agile generative mindset that embraces change, innovates and creates the new


* Is an excellent networker and cross-functional team player with a can-do mindset
* Master of Science or similar within relevant engineering domain
* Fluency in spoken and written English Meritorious qualifications, but not a must:
* Knowledge in safety and security critical software development and coding guidelines relevant for the automotive industry
* Development of embedded software frameworks including API design
* C++, Python and C programming knowledge including best practices and pitfalls
* Automotive experience including standards such as ASPICE
* Some interest of electronics and hardware to be able to understand the big picture and system To be successful in this job we believe that you are a humble team player with great communications skills in English, both written and verbal


**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
--------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 15th of FEB 2025. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.  

  

And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!


Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more

title: Software Design Engineer
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 10+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

We are looking for a Software Design Engineer with expertise in software platforms onLinux and QNX hypervisor and base software development, who will play a pivotal role in designing and implementingground-breaking software solutions for automotive applications. Responsibilities: • Be a part of the base design team, and senior developer of setting long term design strategies of the Embedded SW Platforms for the overall Volvo Group.• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical designs.• Design the integration of the Board support packages (BSP), boot loader and configuration of the hypervisor and Guest OS.• Provide technical guidance and mentorship throughout the development lifecycle. Requirements: • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.• Proven experience as a Software Architect in automotive software development.• Expertise in Linux.• Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++, or Embedded C.• Solid understanding of software architecture and design principles, patterns, and best practices.• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.• Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
  
  

Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Functional Safety Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **5+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

Rollbeskrivning:

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Lead and manage functional safety activities for Zone Controller products


adhering to ISO 26262 with a focus on ASIL D standards.  

* Define and develop functional safety concepts and technical safety


requirements throughout the development lifecycle, including hazard analysis,  

risk assessment, and fault-tree analysis.  

* Oversee the creation of safety plans, verification, and validation strategies to


ensure compliance with industry standards and customer safety requirements.  

* Collaborate with hardware and software engineering teams to ensure that safety


mechanisms are integrated into system designs.  

* Conduct safety audits, reviews, and assessments to validate the safety integrity


of products.  

* Lead and manage failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA), fault-tree analysis


(FTA), and other safety analysis methods to identify potential risks and develop  

mitigation strategies.  

* Ensure traceability of safety requirements from concept phase to production,


ensuring safety goals are met across all stages.  

* Prepare and present safety documentation, such as safety cases, to


stakeholders and regulatory bodies.  

* Act as the primary point of contact with stakeholders and suppliers for


functional safety-related issues.  

* Stay current on industry trends and emerging standards related to automotive


safety and ASIL requirements.  

* Provide training and guidance to internal teams on functional safety best


practices.  

  

**As a person**  

As a person you are very structured, detail oriented alongside that you have an  

analytical mindset. You like to search for information, asking questions and have an  

urge to cross connect all input to bring out the best solutions, as your work will have an  

impact on other parts of the company.  

Furthermore, you are a true team player, that sees benefits of having different  

competences and skill to be successful. To build strong relationships, is something that  

is natural for you, having interpersonal skills and gain trust by deliver with high quality.  

Lastly, we believe that you are that kind of a person that rethink and is curious to learn  

more in areas such as digital tools, new working methods etc.  

  

**Qualifications:**  

* 5+ years of experience in functional safety engineering, preferably within the


automotive industry.  

* In-depth understanding of ISO 26262, particularly with respect to ASIL D.
* Proven experience in functional safety analysis, including FMEA, FTA, and safety


concept development.  

* Strong knowledge of automotive electronics, embedded systems, and safetycritical systems.
* Experience with safety verification and validation techniques, including fault


injection and testing methods.  

* Excellent communication skills with the ability to work effectively in crossfunctional teams.
* Certified Functional Safety Engineer (ISO 26262) or similar certification is


preferred.  

* Project management experience, particularly in managing functional safety


projects, is a plus.**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Panel Builder in Onboarding Technical Engineer - Low Voltage Electrical System

title: Test Engineer - Battery Lab
description:
**Work with us towards a greener future (General)**


Climate change is a reality. As a mobility provider, we recognise our impact on the environment and are determined to play our part in contributing to sustainable solutions. Today, all our cars offer electrified versions, and our goal is to exclusively produce fully electric cars by 2030. If you share our commitment for creating a positive environmental impact, then join us in our mission to advance towards a greener future.

  


**What we offer**  

**Propulsion & Climate Labs** is Volvo Cars’ Centre for testing of propulsion systems in complete vehicle as well as in component form. We operate and develop propulsion test facilities for vehicles, drivelines, electric motors, batteries, transmissions, as well as aerodynamic and climatic testing. Our work includes hardware- and software preparation of testing, test execution and processing of measurement data. We also develop and build new test facilities.

  


The Battery Lab is designed as a lab that can support the industrialization of the future electrified powertrains from Volvo Cars. We work tight together to develop the testing, from battery cells to complete batteries. We are in a technology shift, where the design is changing in a rapid pace and we as a team needs to be agile while delivering repeatable and precise data.


To meet the future, we need to utilize state of the art methods to test and verify next generation cars in an efficient and correct manner. Do you like to work with innovative products and test critical parts of our cars? Do you appreciate the combination of both practical and office work? Then the role as **Test Engineer within the Battery Lab** is the place for you to thrive.

  

  

**What you’ll do**  

In your daily work you will plan, execute and analyze tests together with internal customers. This includes coding test programs, evaluating test results and preparing test objects. You will constantly learn new test methods and systems as we are in an expansion phase.


You will be responsible for the daily operation of the testbed, ensuring that all test equipment used is maintained and calibrated. You will program the automatic test system and code test procedures. The work also requires problem solving and therefore it´s important to have an open mindset and a hands-on attitude.


Last but not least, you will work in a team, constantly developing the battery lab and our way of working.

  


  

**You and your skills**


* Master’s or bachelor’s degree in electronic/electrical/chemical Engineering
* Experience from lab work
* Knowledge within Validation & Verification
* Skills in Python or similar
* Knowledge in Li-ion cells and CAN is meritorious

  

You are an curios team player, who enjoy what great teamwork can bring! You have a genuine interest of batteries and the oppurtunity to work within a laboratory. As a person, you are patient and can keep accuracy over time.


You enjoy working in a young, international team and you are interested in joining one of our social activities like our ping pong tournament or an afterwork with bowling and pizza.

  

  

**How to Apply**  

We welcome your application before **October 21st, 2024**.


Please note that due to GDPR we can’t handle applications via email.


Hope you will become our new colleague!

  


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  



  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
  

  

Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more here  

Curious about our story? Read more here

title: Embedded C/C++ Developers
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Are you a talented
 **C/C++ developer** 
 seeking your next opportunity? Join the Embedded Systems department in Stockholm, where exciting challenges await!
 



  





 The ALTEN Stockholm office is home to a dynamic, highly skilled team of engineers and developers from all over the world who specialize in delivering tailored solutions across sectors like automotive, telecommunications, life sciences, and IT. Known for their collaborative spirit, the team combines deep technical expertise with a proactive, problem-solving approach, fostering an environment where creativity and efficiency meet to drive impactful results for clients. With a strong focus on professional development and a supportive culture, the Stockholm team is dedicated to both individual growth and collective success, making it an exciting and empowering place to be a part of.
 



  





  





**WHAT WE OFFER YOU** 




 Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We believe in growing together by offering opportunities, development and togetherness.
 



 ALTEN operates in several different industries, having a wide variety of assignments, coaching managers and training through ALTEN Academy, which means that it will always be possible to develop at ALTEN. Your wishes will guide your way forward.
 



 As a consultant, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN. Through our different internal networks, such as Women@ALTEN and ALTEN Sports you will get the opportunity to drive topics and activities that are close to your heart. At ALTEN, we think it's important to have a balance between work and spare time, which is why we offer three extra days off a year. We have a collective agreement and offer benefits like pension, insurances and wellness grants.
 



  





  





**WHAT WILL YOU DO** 




**Design and Develop** 
 : Create high-quality, real-time embedded software solutions in C++ for various industries.
 



**Innovate** 
 : Work on the latest technologies such as IoT, AI, and autonomous systems, contributing to exciting projects that shape the future.
 



**Collaborate** 
 : Join forces with talented engineers across multiple disciplines to deliver state-of-the-art products and systems.
 



**Problem Solve** 
 : Tackle technical challenges with creativity and out-of-the-box thinking, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
 



**Grow** 
 : Expand your knowledge through ongoing training, support, and career development within a dynamic, international environment.
 



  





  





**WHO ARE YOU** 



* 3+ years in Embedded C/C++ software development within the automotive industry.
* Strong proficiency in real-time systems, and embedded platforms (ARM, FPGA, etc.).
* Python.
* Bash.
* Jenkins.
* Classic or Adaptive AUTOSAR.
* Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
* Meritorius: experience of Yocto and Buildroot as well as with microcontrollers



  





  





**ABOUT ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Founded in 2015, Instabox is a Sweden-based tech company with the mission to make online shopping easier. In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the merchant at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for a Software Engineer with machine learning knowledge to help us govern our journey ahead!
   

  

**About The Role**
 At the Route Optimization team, you’ll play a crucial role in building, maintaining, and enhancing the models and services that drive our core operations. We follow an end-to-end approach: collecting and preprocessing data, developing and validating models, deploying these models, and integrating them into our routing engine. Your work will directly impact how Instabee optimizes its routes, empowering the business to make informed strategic decisions, improve operational efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction.
   

  

**To Do This We’ll Expect You To**
* Build and maintain models and services and deploy them
* Take the lead on developing new features and refactoring existing code, ensuring high standards of code quality and efficiency
* Stay at the forefront of software development trends, experimenting with new approaches and technologies to continuously improve our systems
* Work closely with algorithm engineers, machine learning engineers, and the broader tech team to share ideas and support each other in achieving our goals
* Advocate for best coding practices, both within the team and across the organization, inspiring others to maintain high standards


**To Succeed In This Role You Probably**
* Love writing high-quality production-grade code
* Have 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer or Machine Learning Engineer, working in a modern tech environment
* Experience in building and deploying machine learning models
* Strong programming skills in Python and Java. Experience with various databases is a plus
* Familiarity with Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, and other DevOps tools
* You’ve led feature development, refactoring efforts, and know how to inspire those around you


 If this is you, we really can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
   

  

 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
   

  

 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
   

  

 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*

title: Backend Engineer - Core Infrastructure
description:
We’re looking for mid-level Backend Engineers to join Spotify’s Core Infrastructure team. You will contribute to the development and optimization of the foundational infrastructure that powers the Spotify platform. This is a highly impactful role and you will be developing the systems that enable Spotify’s engineering teams to deliver robust solutions quickly and efficiently to meet the demands of over a billion customers. You’ll design, build and develop scalable infrastructure services and tools, and collaborate in a cross-functional team.
   

  

 We are currently hiring for two teams within Core Infrastructure:
   

  

 The Abs team is responsible for building the central backend infrastructure and framework upon which hundreds/thousands of engineers at Spotify build the Spotify experience. You will join a team of backend engineers who share a common interest in providing a seamless backend development experience.
   

  

 The Manifesto team is building a cutting-edge declarative platform that manages 50K resources declared in 3,000+ Google Cloud projects, enabling engineers to innovate faster and smarter and Spotify to manage cloud resources at scale. If you're excited about Kubernetes, passionate about infrastructure as code and love solving complex challenges, this might be the perfect opportunity.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* As a part of a collaborative agile team, you will help improve the core infrastructure systems that are the foundation of the rest of Spotify’s backend.
* Design, analyze, and optimize code for large-scale distributed systems to improve platform reliability and scalability
* Working with technologies that are at the forefront of the current tech landscape at Spotify scale (supporting thousands of developers and over a billion customers).
* Participating in an on-call rotation as part of the operational responsibility for services maintained by the team.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are an enthusiastic engineer with an interest in building backend infrastructure.
* You are proficient in Java, with a willingness to pick up other programming languages.
* You are well-versed with scripting languages, such as Bash or Python.
* You have experience with cloud-based environments, CI/CD practices, Kubernetes and infrastructure-as-code.
* You have a passion for learning, experimenting and working with new technologies, while adapting quickly.
* You care deeply about sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, clean code and automated testing.
* You are experienced in designing and building distributed and scalable systems and feel thrilled by the idea of seeing millions of users running your code.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm (Sweden) or London (UK).
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Disrupting fullstack developer
description:
**#Wearegrowing!** 




  





**Company Description** 




 Geofy envisions a future where every homeowner has control over their energy needs and is essentially self-sufficient in energy and electricity. Currently, few households have the opportunity to become self-sufficient in energy and electricity. Geofy's energy subscription provides all households with a simple solution to this complex problem.

 This is a full-time on-site role for a Disrupting Fullstack Developer at Geofy in Stockholm. The role involves day-to-day tasks related to react, node.js, python, IOT devices integrations, MQTT queues and a lot of AI models and data analysis.
 



  





 A plus for dart/flutter mobile development as well as expo/react native.
 



  





 If you dont fit the bill perfectly, dont worry. We are learning as well!

* Senior Full-stack js with focus on backend
* Can-do mentality
* Experience with energy or sustainability projects is a plus
* Preferred Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar work experience.



  





**NOTE: We like to work together, so being in Stockholm office daily is key.**

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
På Sigma Technology Digital Solutions söker vi passionerade fullstackutvecklare. Vi tror på att skapa möjligheter som inte bara främjar karriärer utan också bidrar till en bättre morgondag.

title: Data Engineer
job_function: Information Technology, Analyst, and Product Management
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Data Services, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
Apoteket genomgår en spännande förändring mot en datadriven kultur i hela organisationen. Med modern teknik utvecklar vi vår förmåga att tillvarata värdet i vår data och vi letar nu efter en person som kommer ha en avgörande roll i denna förändringsresa. Som Data Engineer på Apoteket är du med och bidrar i vårt viktiga arbete för ett liv i hälsa – för varje individ och samhället i stort.
 



  





 Som Data Enginner ingår du i team Data Analytics på Apoteket Tech, en funktion som spelar en avgörande roll i bolagets digitala transformation. Teamet består idag av sex medarbetare och fem konsulter och ansvarar för såväl BI, avancerad analys och data governance. Apotekets tekniska förmåga för analys pågår just nu en omfattande modernisering då Apoteket lämnar en dataplattform on-prem och utvecklar av en ny i Azure.
 



  





**Data Engineer på Apoteket** 




 I rollen som Data Engineer kommer du arbeta med att designa, utveckla och optimera vår dataplattform och datainfrastruktur. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att möjliggöra datadrivna beslut och skapa insikter som stärker vårt erbjudande och vår service till våra kunder. Apoteket har idag en av Sveriges största kundklubbar med över 3,5 miljoner medlemmar och 2024 genomfördes över cirka 100 miljoner kundbesök vilket gör Apoteket till rätt arbetsplats för dig som gillar data.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsområden** 



* Utveckla och förvalta integrationer och dataflöden mellan den centrala dataplattformen och omkringliggande systemstöd
* Implementera datakvalitetskontroller och säkerställa att data är korrekt, konsistent och aktuell.
* Förbereda data för BI och avancerad analys, såsom AI /ML för prediktion eller segmentering.
* Utveckla arkitekturen i såväl datalager som teknisk plattform för att möta verksamhetens behov i samråd med arkitekter.
* Samarbeta med data scientists, data analysts och slutanvändare vid utveckling av analys och beslutsstöd.
* Utforska och introducera nya teknologier, ramverk och verktyg för att förbättra datahanteringen.



  





**Dina kompetenser** 




 Du är trygg i din tekniska expertis och tar välgrundade beslut med ett tydligt fokus på målet. Du är resultatorienterad, tar ansvar för hela processen och ser till att lösningar genomförs effektivt.
 



 Med nyfikenhet, en stark analytisk förmåga och affärsfokus letar du ständiga förbättringar för att säkerställa värde över tid.
 



  





**Utöver detta vill vi att du har** 



* Relevant utbildning inom system-, information- eller datavetenskap, matematik, statistik eller AI/ML
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete i en liknande roll som Data Engineer
* Erfarenhet av integration, ETL/ELT-flöden och SQL
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som GCP, Azure eller AWS
* Goda kunskaper i programmering, exempelvis Python
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift



  





 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta som Data Engineer inom retail eller reglerad verksamhet såsom försäkring, bank eller apoteksbranschen. Det är också en fördel om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en projektledande roll.
 



  





  





**När det känns rätt** 




 Fundera inte för länge. Låt oss i stället berätta om rollen och om verksamheten så kan du sen avgöra om det känns rätt för dig. Ansök nu!
 



 Vi vill att din ansökan består av ditt CV samt svar på våra urvalsfrågor. Du behöver alltså inte skicka med ett personligt brev. Urvalsfrågorna hjälper oss att bättre förstå din erfarenhet och dina kvalifikationer för den aktuella rollen och öka vår träffsäkerhet.
 



 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
 



**Välkommen till Apoteket!**

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Senior Infrastructure Engineer
 



**Locations:** 
 London, Oslo, Stockholm, Tallin, Madrid, Barcelona, Lahore
 



**Working Model:** 
 Hybrid, with a 3 days in the office requirement
 



**Benefits:** 
 Private Health Care
 



  





**About Us** 




 Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs and the global shift towards local and more sustainable production.
 



 In many ways, we at Gelato are rethinking how digital fabrication of customized products can be done on-demand. Just imagine what will happen when we add 3D printing capabilities to this global service. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses.
 



  





**Gelato Technology** 




 We own no physical production assets, nor servers, instead our asset is a cloud based connectivity platform that enables world-class on-demand production for e-commerce platforms and applications. This engineered platform needs to provide our customers access to more than 130 production partners in 32 countries and includes production plate design, routing to an appropriate partner, finally linking to logistics’ systems for delivery to the consumer. All this in 72 hours and reaching more than 5 billion people and potential consumers in a smarter, faster, and greener way.
 



 The employed technologies range from backends using PHP and GoLang to mobile apps built natively or with hybrid technology, running on cloud services and with a modern CI/CD pipeline. Designing highly-available, fault-tolerant, cost-effective, scalable systems is our passion. We are using TDD, BDD, DDD principles and patterns, and agile methodology. Designing public API for millions of people, integrating with world-class third-party systems, and solving complex engineering problems (Graph, CAP, etc) are only a small glimpse into the tasks.
 







**About The Position** 




**What you will do** 



* **Innovate and Strategize:** 
 Design and implement strategic initiatives that propel Gelato's infrastructure forward, ensuring alignment with our rapid growth and innovation objectives.
* **Automate Everything:** 
 Be an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) champion, driving automation to streamline processes and enhance efficiency.
* **Champion Reliability and Efficiency:** 
 Optimize our cloud infrastructure, ensuring maximum uptime, performance, and cost-effectiveness.
* **Collaborate for Success:** 
 Partner with Engineering to craft resilient cloud applications. Automate deployments, implement robust monitoring and alerting, and solidify our DevOps practices through IaC.
* **Embrace Availability:** 
 Contribute to our culture of continuous availability by participating in the on-call rotation, demonstrating your commitment to platform excellence.
* **Harness the Power of AI:** 
 Explore the use of AI to modernize our cloud production platform, unlocking new levels of insight and automation.
* **Optimize Through FinOps:** 
 Promote a FinOps mindset, ensuring we make conscious, data-driven decisions to optimize cloud costs.



**Who you are** 



* **Education & Experience:** 
 You hold a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline, backed by at least 5 years of hands-on experience in cloud infrastructure, automation, and DevOps.
* **Cloud Mastery:** 
 You possess deep expertise in major cloud service providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) and a thorough understanding of cloud best practices. You're passionate about building scalable and efficient SaaS platforms.
* **DevOps Toolset:** 
 You have proven expertise in essential cloud DevOps automation tools like Kubernetes (K8s), Terraform, and Helm. Your experience drives seamless CI/CD pipelines, configuration management, and containerization for our SaaS environment.
* **Technical Fluency:** 
 You have working knowledge of programming languages like Python and Go, as well as modern platform development and infrastructure automation.
* **Problem-Solving & Collaboration:** 
 You are an exceptional problem solver, able to navigate complex challenges in fast-paced environments. Collaboration is key to your success as you work to deliver high-quality SaaS products within our production platform.



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 16 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
Would you like to play a key part in Toca Boca’s Data and Insights Team? With over 60 million monthly active users and terabytes of daily data, in the role of a Senior Analytics Engineer you will play an integral role in understanding and developing our analytics infrastructure that handles petabyte scale data for both Toca and our owners Spin Master.
 



 Our team is a unique blend of data insights functions, namely data science, data engineering, business intelligence as well as analytics engineering.
 



  





  





**What you’ll be doing** 




  





 As a Senior Analytics Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, developing, and optimising dbt models that transform raw data into actionable insights. By leveraging your expertise in dbt and BigQuery, you will help ensure our data pipelines are scalable, efficient, and cost-effective. Collaborating closely with data engineers and data scientists, you’ll facilitate the creation of reliable, well-structured data models that support advanced analytics and decision-making across the organisation.
 



  





 You’ll work hand-in-hand with data scientists and analysts to understand their needs, ensuring the availability of clean and optimized data for analysis, modeling, and experimentation. Together with the data engineering team, you’ll integrate new data sources, optimize materialization strategies, and fine-tune performance to handle large-scale workloads seamlessly. Your role will also involve promoting best practices in data modeling and fostering a culture of collaboration between analytics and engineering teams.
 



  





  





**Is this you?** 




  





 You are an experienced data professional with a strong track record in dbt model development, including modular code, testing, and documentation. You have expertise in designing scalable materialization strategies, identifying performance bottlenecks, and optimizing queries for cost-efficiency in BigQuery.
 



  





 You are comfortable working closely with cross-functional teams, from data engineers to data scientists, to align technical efforts with analytical goals. You have strong stakeholder management skills, excelling at translating requirements into effective data solutions while balancing performance, cost, and usability. Additionally, you have a passion for driving technical excellence, sharing knowledge, and fostering a collaborative work environment.
 



 You are a team player who is good at unblocking the team and driving a high standard for quality and ease of improvement.
 



 You believe in the power of play!
 



  





  





**This is us!** 




  





 Toca Boca captures the spirit of play and is key within the Digital Games group within Spin Master. We create digital toys and everyday products that are filled with fun and silliness that kids from any corner of the world can instantly relate to. Everything is designed from their perspective.
 



  





 The Spin Master Mission and Vision is to make life more fun by pushing the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun!.
 



  





  





**Good to know!** 




  





 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm studio with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). We apply a 6-month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support relocation. As we’re an international company, with over 20 nationalities working here, and millions of users all over the world, you need to be fluent in English. Your application should therefore be in English.

title: Principal Rendering Programmer
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is seeking a Senior/Principal Graphics Programmer to join our team to work on our upcoming AAA title Contraband. Contraband is a brand-new IP published by Xbox Game Studios.
   

  

 As a Senior/Principal Graphics Programmer at Avalanche Studios Group you will work with some of the industry's most talented individuals who are developing our cutting-edge, next-generation, open-world graphics engine. We at Avalanche Studios have a solid reputation for producing great-looking open-world games, and this is a terrific opportunity for the candidate who wants to play an essential part in developing the next incarnation of the engine that will set the bar for the industry.
   

  

 You will be designing, developing and enhancing both high-level and low-level graphics-related systems within the Avalanche Engine. You will be working across the range of the graphics and rendering pipeline, addressing multiple hardware platforms including next-generation consoles, and applying state-of-the-art computer graphics research to code that works under actual AAA gaming conditions.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Research techniques and algorithms in order to keep current on technological developments and advancements in the game industry
* Be on top of GPU performance, do regular profiling and plan for performance improvement.
* Take initiative and contribute innovative and original ideas towards all aspects of engine and game production and development.
* Identify technical and developmental risks/obstacles and generate solutions to overcome identified risks.
* Review the work of other engineers and provide mentorship.


**Who You Are**
* Extensive experience of professional C/C++ programming.
* Prior experience working as a graphics programmer on at least one shipped title on current (or prev)-gen consoles.
* Good knowledge of modern rendering architectures and APIs - ( ie.DX12 , Vulkan.)
* Solid background in rendering with experience in HLSL/Cg writing shaders.
* Strong math skills with excellent knowledge about 3D graphics algorithms and techniques.
* Low-level profiling and optimization skills, ability to write memory- and cache-friendly code.
* Good communicator in cross-functional teams.
* You should be passionate about keeping up with the latest graphics technology.


**Bonus**
* CUDA, OpenCL, compute shader experience.
* Hardcore low-level optimization experiences
* Commitment to code quality, documentation and testing procedures.
* Experience with developing art & content pipelines/workflows.
* Experience with writing code in Python.
* Leadership experience


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
